description: Nestled in the heart of Lebanon, Mezyan offers an authentic dining experience that draws both locals and tourists with its exquisite Lebanese cuisine. The ambiance is warm and inviting, perfect for family gatherings or intimate dinners. The standout dishes showcase the rich culinary heritage of the region, making it a must-visit for food enthusiasts eager to explore traditional flavors that are often overlooked. scamWarning: Be cautious of nearby street vendors offering unsolicited food samples, as they might charge you unexpectedly.

topReviews.author: Ziad Dakroub
topReviews.text:
Hidden in the middle of Hamra street the restaurant has decent arabic food and a nice ambiance  but like most hamra outlets it caters and appeal to a certain category of people .
DJ is ok, but the playlist can be enhanced.
They have a ventilation issue though usually is a zone smoking but on Sat is seems they tuen an eye.
Price is mid

topReviews.author: Yara Gebara
topReviews.text:
This was my first time trying Mezyan, I had heard so many good things about from friends and family so I had to try it.

The place is nestled in Hamra but doesn‚Äôt feel like it‚Äôs in the city because of the vibes and how chill the place can be (before the party).

The food was good. I got to try some meze and other items.

I do recommend trying the place and if you also enjoy an Arabic oldies night, they host some really nice parties on weekends.

topReviews.author: Bargo Yousif
topReviews.text: Cozy and great vibes restaurant/bar. They have a great live-music band who lighting up the place with energy. Food is tasty and they have great variety of drinks. Staff are super friendly and you'll mingle in as it's your own back yard. Smoking is allowed indoors, but you won't feel too much smoke in. It's a good experience that I'm definitely going to redo. One important note: if you come through Hamra street, there's no sign outside! The place is inside a building. The location is correct so just go inside the electric/automatic door and you will see it in front of you.

name: Yakiniku
description: Yakiniku is a delightful hidden gem in Lebanon that specializes in Japanese barbecue, offering a unique culinary experience that stands out amidst the traditional offerings of the region. Guests can enjoy grilling their own meats and vegetables at the table, allowing for a personalized dining experience. With its cozy atmosphere and attentive staff, Yakiniku is perfect for both casual meals and special occasions. The fusion of flavors will leave your taste buds craving more.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit during lunch hours for a quieter experience and special lunch deals.
localTip: Try the premium wagyu beef for an unforgettable taste experience.
scamWarning: Ensure to confirm the prices of items before ordering, as some dishes can be pricier than expected.

topReviews.author: WenMaken
topReviews.text:
We recently enjoyed a VIP experience at this restaurant, and it truly delivered. The food was excellent, with a variety that keeps every visit exciting. Everything we tried was flavorful and beautifully presented, and the whole experience was captured perfectly in the photos we took. ü•òü•¢

The ambiance overall was great, though we do wish the music had been a bit more suitable for the restaurant‚Äôs concept. It‚Äôs a small detail, but adjusting it would elevate the entire atmosphere.

Still, the service, the food, and the overall vibe made it a memorable visit. Definitely worth trying!

topReviews.author: TonY NouH
topReviews.text:
A Unique Dining Experience at Yakiniku

This was my first time visiting Yakiniku, and it was truly a memorable experience. What makes this restaurant stand out is its interactive dining concept. Each table is equipped with a built-in grill, allowing you to cook your own meat and vegetables exactly the way you like them. It adds a fun, social element to the meal, whether you‚Äôre with friends or family.

The service was excellent‚Äîthe staff were attentive, helpful, and always ready to assist, especially for first-timers unfamiliar with this style of dining. They took the time to explain the menu and even provided grilling tips to ensure everything was cooked to perfection.

The atmosphere was warm and inviting, with a modern Japanese-inspired d√©cor that complements the overall experience. Soft lighting, comfortable seating, and a relaxed ambiance make it a great place to unwind.

For those who enjoy a drink with their meal, the restaurant offers a selection of alcoholic beverages, including sake, beer, and cocktails, which pair well with the grilled dishes.

Considering the quality of the food and the interactive experience, the prices are quite reasonable, making it accessible for both casual outings and special occasions.

Overall, Yakiniku is a great spot for anyone looking to enjoy fresh ingredients, hands-on cooking, and a cozy dining environment. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

topReviews.author: Dana Ajouz
topReviews.text: I love this place! The food and service were amazing :) Special thanks our waiter that night, unfortunately I didn‚Äôt get his name. Also the house wine was a huuuge plus! It was a 4-year old wine and it was quite tasty! The meat is also good quality, I‚Äôd love to go there again. Thank you!

name: Manara Palace

name: Ritage Garden

name: Makan
description: Makan is a vibrant Indian restaurant in Lebanon that brings the rich and diverse flavors of Indian cuisine to the forefront. This hidden gem is known for its authentic dishes and warm hospitality, making it a favorite among locals and visitors alike. The colorful decor and lively ambiance create an inviting atmosphere where diners can indulge in a culinary journey through India without leaving Beirut.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings are ideal for a more lively dining experience, especially on weekends when the restaurant fills up with locals.
localTip: Don't miss their butter chicken and naan bread, which are highly recommended by returning customers.
scamWarning: Be wary of unsolicited help navigating the area, as some individuals may seek to lead you to overpriced tourist traps.

topReviews.author: Joe Turk
topReviews.text:
We had a great experience at Jacaranda and Makan. The restaurant offers a combination of two menus: an Asian-Indian-Thai menu and an international one. We tried the lentil salad from the international menu, along with several flavorful Indian and Thai dishes from the Asian menu ‚Äî everything we had was truly delicious.

The ambiance was just as impressive. The place has a beautiful garden setting in the summer, surrounded by trees, creating a cozy and private atmosphere with dimmed lighting ‚Äî perfect for a relaxed evening.

The service was excellent too. The staff were extremely friendly and attentive, which made our visit even more enjoyable.
If you're planning to go, be sure to explore dishes from both menus ‚Äî they complement each other really well.
I definitely recommend this spot ‚Äî it‚Äôs a lovely place all around.

topReviews.author: Rita Doumet
topReviews.text:
Unmatched atmosphere. Highly recommended for a cozy romantic date.
The food is remarkable as well. I tried the chicken tikka masala and spring rolls.

topReviews.author: Gino Haddad
topReviews.text:
Makan has recently relocated to a new venue, now sharing the same space as Jacaranda, a restaurant specializing in Mediterranean cuisine. Despite the move, Makan remains a well-established name, widely known for its Indian dishes.
The new location is truly beautiful, with a particularly charming outdoor area that adds to the overall experience. This is not a place for a quick meal; instead, it‚Äôs best enjoyed at a leisurely pace. The atmosphere encourages guests to relax, soak in the surroundings, and take their time.
The food was decent, with portions that felt just right‚Äînot too much, not too little. Service was warm and friendly, though a bit slow, likely due to the staff being slightly overwhelmed. However, the inviting outdoor setting more than made up for it. I would definitely return just to enjoy that lovely space again.

name: Boustane

The food was tasty and delicious, especially the sausages and burgers which were nicely prepared. The chef appeared professional in his work. However, the service was disappointing.

We asked for extra buns for the sausages and the waiter welcomed our request, promising to add them to our order. However, when the dishes arrived, the buns were missing. The waiter then claimed he had forgotten to add them, citing our earlier conversation with the chef about extra buns.

We asked for the buns again and he promised to bring them but then repeated the same mistake. Finally, after a third request, he arrived and informed us that they were charged extra. He seemed to think we didn‚Äôt want to pay or that we were greedy.

We also asked to replace the salads with fries as he had initially suggested but were instead served with salads.

They dont have outdoor heaters so it can get chilly - they switched our table to an indoor one upon our request
Music was fun
Drinks we had espresso martinis, which was one of the best I ever took, a drink with jelly beans (it was special) and wine
Food we had the cajun fries/bruschettas tomato/edamame/chicken strips. All were good except the bruschettas

topReviews.author: Sarah Saleh
topReviews.text: Wasn‚Äôt up to expectation at all. We ordered London mule, it tasted nothing like it. The order was returned 3 times till it was right. Also, the margarita wasn‚Äôt good at all. However, the service was excellent, the staff is very friendly and were more than happy to return our drinks and make new ones.

topReviews.author: Jad Haj Chahine
topReviews.text:
I can see the reviews are dragging the overall rating. I think this place deserve much more credit, therefore the 5 star review.
This place is a nice hidden gem in the heart of Ashrafieh. Best thing about this place is the nice vibe it has, you'll get the feeling that you're surrounded by nice people in a nicely presented setting. The service is good, food and cocktails are delicious and the music was perfect.
Try out this place and don't judge it by its rating. Recommended

name: Em Sherif SEA Cafe
description: Em Sherif SEA Cafe is a picturesque seafood restaurant that offers stunning views of the Mediterranean, making it a perfect spot for a romantic dinner or a special gathering. With its fresh seafood dishes prepared with a Lebanese twist, this hidden gem boasts a rating of 4.3 and is beloved for its vibrant flavors and beautiful presentation. The warm, welcoming ambiance complements the exquisite culinary experience, making it a must-visit on your Lebanese food journey.
bestTimeToVisit: Sunset hours for breathtaking views over the sea.
localTip: Order the mezze platter to sample a variety of seafood delicacies.
scamWarning: Watch out for unsolicited offers from nearby vendors trying to lure you in.

topReviews.author: Dana Diab
topReviews.text:
Consistency is key! Em sherif Sea Cafe never disappoints!
Everything we ordered was delicious as usual; various selection of Lebanese meze and seafood dishes.
The service was great and welcoming.

topReviews.author: Farah F
topReviews.text:
If hospitality and professional needed a definition; it would be em sherif! Em sherif is Always on top of all. From the staff to the food to everything.. em sherif is an experience not only a restaurant to have lunch or dinner at. Yesterday i went with my mom craving their fish burger, and it was so delicious as usual. It‚Äôs one of my favorite dishes.
We also had the fish shawerma and it was soooo goood. Everything was perfect.
Definitely recommended

topReviews.author: Racha Sweid
topReviews.text:
Food was great ! We tried lots of items and all were top notch
Service is very good . Loved the atmosphere of the place . Desserts were amazing specially the honey cake ! Great experience highly recommended

name: Nour (’Ü’∏÷Ç÷Ä), Fine Armenian Cuisine
description: Tucked away in the vibrant streets of Beirut, Nour offers a delightful journey into Armenian cuisine with a modern twist. The warm ambiance and artistic decor set the stage for a memorable dining experience, where each dish is crafted with passion and tradition. From their succulent kebabs to homemade lavash, every bite reflects the rich culinary heritage of Armenia, making it a must-visit for food enthusiasts looking to explore beyond the usual Lebanese fare.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit during the cooler months from October to April for a comfortable dining experience.
localTip: Try their signature dishes like Khashlama and Mante, and don‚Äôt forget to ask for the homemade pickles on the side!
scamWarning: Always confirm the menu prices before ordering, as some places may add extra charges unexpectedly.

topReviews.author: Rima D
topReviews.text:
In my opinion, the best Armenian food in Beirut. Their muhammara is very good, their Suberek is delicious and not oily. And their special house kebab with cherries, yogurt and pistachio is a must!
The service is a bit slow, but it might be due to the current economic situation where  they're not expecting to be busy...

topReviews.author: Rodolphe Ghossoub
topReviews.text:
I visited Nour on monday and couldn't wait longer than yesterday eve to visit it again. On Monday i was with a native Armenian person who loved it so much.
The setting is relaxing, a fusion of a modern set and  Armenian objects, niched in an old Beirut house.
Food is great. For me this is the best Mant√© and  Soubereg i had in Lebanon.
Staff is young, a bit hesitant but nice.
The only turn down is the price of the Armenian wine. White Karas for 76.000LL. You will never pay 50usd for an ordinary bottle of wine in Armenia. This is too much. But the price of food is reasonable.
I surely recommend

topReviews.author: Melted Butter
topReviews.text: I found this armenian restaurant to be overpriced. The platters are not fullfilling and comes with no sides a simple kebbab for its price with nothing on the side . The house kebab was too sweet , cherry was overpowering as its its dessert. The armenian and aleppo lahem baajine were thin and tasty . I liked the meat manti , the texture of the manti was good . Prices are on high range . Portion of dishes is small.

name: Luigi Cucina Italiana
description: For those craving authentic Italian flavors in Lebanon, Luigi Cucina Italiana is a hidden gem that transports you straight to Italy. With its cozy atmosphere and friendly service, this restaurant prides itself on using fresh ingredients to create traditional dishes like risotto and homemade pasta. The inviting aroma of garlic and herbs wafts through the air, enticing diners to indulge in a culinary experience that feels both homey and sophisticated.
bestTimeToVisit: The best time to visit is during weekday evenings when the restaurant is less crowded.
localTip: Don‚Äôt miss the Tiramisu for dessert; it‚Äôs a crowd favorite and perfectly made!
scamWarning: Be cautious of any special offers that appear too good to be true; clarify the details before ordering.

topReviews.author: Ziad Dakroub
topReviews.text:
Nice cozy Italian restaurant  with a big menu selection. All the Italian plates are very tasty . If you‚Äôre trying the place stick to that. Service is a bit slow I order some extra bread, we finish the Salad before we got it. Ordered mustard almost finished my meat plate before we got it. They had a little mistake with the order but they offered nothing in return.
Dessert menu is limited
Price Value is good

topReviews.author: Rana Andari
topReviews.text: Was one of my favorite places. Renewed and reopened and still one of my favorite places. Nowhere else in Beirut can you have such a delicious linguini alle vongole (I have been craving it for a while). All the ingredients used at Luigi are the definition of freshness. This family-owned business is like all others they previously owned‚Ä¶ simply impeccable.

topReviews.author: Rana Schafer
topReviews.text:
If I could give 10 stars, I would. The place and service were amazing. The staff was welcoming and gave us our choice of tables. We were a party of six and ordered the prix-fixe menu.

To start,¬† a wonderful assortment of breads, bruschetta, plate of salads including fresh mozzarella and tomatoes,¬† endives in a delicious dressing,¬† and a baked eggplant and mozzarella with tomatoe sauce.

The main course was assortment of pastas and pizza. We tried the Linguine Gamberi E Limone with shrimp,¬† Gnocchi Al pesto,¬† mushroom Risoto, Cannelloni con ricotta e spinaci, and a ham and mushroom pizza. We honestly liked every one.¬† The dough of the pizza was delicious.

Now come the desserts... an assortment of 4 - Tiramisu, Panna Cotta, Creme Brulee, and Pain Perdu. They were all just the right sweetness and a perfect end to the meal.¬† I can easily go there for lunch and order just the desserts.

The prices were very reasonable - $29 per person.¬† We also had 3 glasses of wine and a couple of bottles of water.

The staff was very attentive and courteous. I also want to add honest.¬† While paying,¬† I dropped a cash bill and did not notice.¬† The waiter followed us to the car to give it back.¬† Thank you! You're one of a kind.

name: Pamai Chop
description: Nestled in a quiet corner of Beirut, Pamai Chop is a culinary haven known for its exquisite Asian fusion dishes. This charming restaurant combines flavors from various Asian cuisines, creating a unique menu that caters to adventurous palates. With its sleek decor and relaxing ambiance, it‚Äôs the perfect spot for a casual dinner with friends or a romantic night out, where each plate tells a story of culinary creativity.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit in the early evening to enjoy a quieter atmosphere and better service.
localTip: The Bao Buns are a must-try; they are soft, fluffy, and packed with flavor!
scamWarning: Check your bill carefully, as some dishes may have additional charges that aren't clearly stated.

topReviews.author: Rajeev Botejue
topReviews.text: This place was simply fantastic! I stumbled across it when walking through Badaro and so glad I came here for lunch! The place is beautifully designed inside with calm African vibes and the food is incredible!  I had the beef skewers which were marinated in this peanut sauce and it was super tasty! And the staff were super kind, friendly and informative! Highly recommend this place and will definitely come back when I return to Beirut.

topReviews.author: m z
topReviews.text: Great decor and ambiance, very friendly, helpful staff. They have the best fries I have ever tasted! Had the suya beef skewers. The beef was tender and tasty along with great dip aside and some essential onion chops to complete the experience. Didn't get the authentic African taste from this dish but maybe other options on the menu might have more African flavor. The drinks are a must try!

topReviews.author: Mazen Eid
topReviews.text: As much as i had high expectations on this place, I was disappointed by many things. The food is good and not wow, coming from an African background I know how african food taste. The music is so loud you can‚Äôt even talk with anyone you need to make your voice louder. The waiters are incompetent, they don‚Äôt know the menu well, above all that I guess the owners were sitting in the restaurant having fun with their friends instead of checking on the customers if all is ok. Anyways I highly appreciate the service of the woman at the entrance she was the only helpful one. Appreciate next time you work on the waiters knowledge and ensure they are aware of everything.

name: Basterma Mano
description: Basterma Mano is a delightful eatery that specializes in traditional Lebanese fast food with a twist. Renowned for its mouthwatering basterma sandwiches, this spot is perfect for a quick yet satisfying meal. The lively atmosphere and friendly staff enhance the experience, making it a favorite among locals and visitors alike. Whether you're grabbing a bite on the go or enjoying a meal with friends, Basterma Mano has something to please every palate.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit during lunchtime to experience the bustling vibe and fresh offerings.
localTip: Pair your sandwich with a side of their homemade fries for the ultimate comfort food experience!
scamWarning: Be wary of upselling tactics; stick to your order to avoid unnecessary add-ons.

topReviews.author: Maryam Jamal
topReviews.text:
The Entire vacation i kept going back to eat from MANO. Clean and have a variety of sandwiches to choose from My personal favourite is Beef Shawarma and Soujouk sandwich also you have to try the Hotdog ones.
They place is on the takeout kinda vibes so park whenever you can and walk to it.
Trust me it will be worth it.

topReviews.author: Riham‚Äôs Wanderings
topReviews.text:
This place doesn‚Äôt even need a rating! The food is super delicious, from their shawarma and sandwiches to the burgers and amazing bakery. One of my favorite beef shawarmas is at this place, and the soujouk burger and soujouk shawarmas are a must-try if you love soujouk. Also, their Lebanese burger tastes like homemade.
This place is my go-to whenever I want a cheat meal. Very clean, fast service, and respectful staff.

topReviews.author: Claire
topReviews.text:
Simply perfection.
The quality, the food, the staff... everything.
The place is super clean and the fridges too.
The staff, even late at night, with all the people inside, they remained super kind and very friendly.
Most places after becoming popular lose their quality but not Mano, the fries were crispy, the garlic paste was on another level.
I highly recommend you coming to visit.

name: Seza - Bistro Arm√©nien
description: Seza - Bistro Arm√©nien is a charming bistro that celebrates the flavors of Armenian cuisine in a cozy setting. With its inviting decor and friendly atmosphere, this restaurant is perfect for those looking to savor authentic dishes made from family recipes passed down through generations. The menu features a variety of options, from grilled meats to vegetarian delights, ensuring that there‚Äôs something for everyone to enjoy.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings are ideal for a relaxed dining experience, especially on weekends when live music is often featured.
localTip: Try the Kibbeh and the traditional Armenian coffee for an authentic taste of the culture!
scamWarning: Always confirm the dish ingredients if you have dietary restrictions to avoid surprises.

topReviews.author: Mike Aoun
topReviews.text: We went there on a quiet tuesday and it was a very nice experience. The staff were very friendly and the food was very good. Prices are good as well. I love the authentic decorations and vibes inside the store, every piece carries a story.

topReviews.author: Mohamed Irba
topReviews.text: We came here for dinner and loved it. Great food and service and love the outdoor seating. It was our first time trying Armenian food and every dish we tried was delicious. Basterma was a highlight.

topReviews.author: Tim Ryan
topReviews.text: It was a little quiet when we were there but it's an atmospheric room with a lovely terrace too. Food is essentially mezze Armenian style and is excellent. Service very friendly. Slightly along from the main nightlife area but worth the trek.

name: Mario e Mario
description: Nestled away from the bustling streets of Beirut, Mario e Mario is a delightful Italian restaurant that offers a cozy atmosphere and authentic flavors that will transport you straight to Italy. Known for its handmade pasta and delectable pizzas, this hidden gem is a favorite among locals who appreciate quality food in a charming setting.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings during the weekdays are ideal for a quiet dinner, while weekends can be lively with more patrons.
localTip: Try their truffle pasta, a local favorite that consistently receives rave reviews!
scamWarning: Be cautious of street vendors near popular tourist spots offering 'authentic' Italian goods; it's best to stick to the restaurant for a genuine experience.

topReviews.author: Shayan El Hajj
topReviews.text:
Food is an 8/10
Very authentic and italian
Gluten-free option available which is amazing!
Service was a bit slow on a Sunday even though it was almost empty.
I recommend the Burrata, Caprese and Bruschetta mostly.
The chicken was a bit dry, however pasta is big portion.

topReviews.author: Lamis El Ghor
topReviews.text: A very nice Italian restaurant though we had higher expectations for sure. Food is nice but service would have almost ruined it with some weird statements and behaviour which you wouldn't expect from such a well established restaurant. Not sure would go back but a definite try in the neighbourhood

topReviews.author: heinz giering
topReviews.text: Over all a good place. They have both indoor and terrace upstairs seating. Nice and cozy place with good food and large portions. The service was good with some small mistakes, but overall not bad. We have had take out a few times but this was the first time dining in. A must visit.

address: 39, Rue Patriarche Arida, Mar Michael, ÿ®Ÿäÿ±Ÿàÿ™ÿå Lebanon

name: Ramen-ya
description: Ramen-ya is a delightful find for those craving authentic Japanese ramen in Lebanon. With its warm ambiance and attentive service, this restaurant serves a variety of rich broths and fresh ingredients that will satisfy your taste buds. The cozy setting makes it a perfect spot for a comforting meal after a long day exploring the city.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit during lunch hours for a quieter experience and great lunch specials.
localTip: Don‚Äôt miss out on their spicy miso ramen‚Äîit's a crowd favorite that packs a flavorful punch!
scamWarning: Be wary of counterfeit ramen shops around; always opt for places with good reviews and a solid local presence.

topReviews.author: Ricky Dakouny
topReviews.text: Tucked in the heart of Beirut, Ramenya has become my go-to ramen refuge. It‚Äôs central yet feels hiden, warm, cozy, and effortlessly authentic. Their 12-hour rich broth is what sets it apart: deep, comforting, and layered with flavor in every sip. Whether you‚Äôre escaping the city rush or chasing that perfect noodle bowl, this little gem always hits the spot. üçú‚ú®

topReviews.author: Afif Banna
topReviews.text:
Oh. My. God. I almost jumped out of my seat that‚Äôs how good it was.
The chicken katsu curry was out of this world, and the ramen? So, so good.

Slightly on the expensive side ; it is not overpriced, just a bit up there. But honestly, worth every penny.
Friendly staff, cozy vibe, great experience overall. Will definitely be coming back.

topReviews.author: The diary guide
topReviews.text:
A very nice place. I loved the Ramen‚Äîthe portions are generous and they are very fair with the ingredients they put inside. The staff were welcoming, well-behaved, and provided good service.

My only negative note is that it was a bit cold inside. Also, as a small suggestion, adding some Japanese-style music would really complete the vibe and transport you to the right atmosphere. It‚Äôs a small place, but definitely a good experience.

name: Hammoudi Snack
description: Hammoudi Snack is a beloved fast-food spot in Lebanon where you can indulge in mouthwatering Lebanese snacks. Known for its generous portions and affordable prices, this eatery is a hit among locals and visitors alike, serving everything from shawarma to fresh salads in a laid-back atmosphere.
bestTimeToVisit: Late-night visits are popular, especially after a night out in the city, when the craving for delicious fast food hits.
localTip: Try their signature garlic sauce with any dish‚Äîit elevates the flavors to a whole new level!
scamWarning: Stay away from street food vendors that look unkempt, as food safety can be a concern.

topReviews.author: Morhaf Homsi
topReviews.text: Escalope burger is their special, same taste since 20 years. Any time I'm in Beirut Hammoudi is a must.

topReviews.author: Adam Tawil
topReviews.text: All 5 stars. I recommend the Escalop burger with a side of fries. What‚Äôs better? You can leave half the burger in the fridge for later!

topReviews.author: Marwan
topReviews.text:
Greatest escalope of the town!

This place is famous in their Escalope and Kafta sandwich!

I would highly recommend to order if with extra garlic and avocado sauce (in case you are a fan)
The price is very affordable.. the escalope sandwich is for 4$ only!!

It is the place to please your hunger!!

name: Tom & Mutz
description: Tom & Mutz is a charming restaurant that offers a delightful fusion of flavors in a cozy, welcoming environment. With a menu that features a mix of local and international dishes, this hidden gem is perfect for food lovers looking to try something new and delicious, all while enjoying the friendly service that keeps patrons coming back.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings are particularly enjoyable, as the restaurant often hosts live music, creating a vibrant atmosphere.
localTip: Don‚Äôt skip their dessert menu, especially the homemade baklava that is perfect for sharing!
scamWarning: Avoid accepting unsolicited offers from food delivery apps; always order directly from the restaurant for the best experience.

topReviews.author: mtanios saoud
topReviews.text:
Hands down the best food I‚Äôve ever had in Lebanon.
We ordered linguine, steak, burrata, and wine ‚Äî every single dish was executed perfectly. The flavors were refined, balanced, and memorable. Quality ingredients, excellent technique, and clear attention to detail.
Service was equally outstanding: attentive, professional, and genuinely welcoming.
I was there with my wife for her birthday, and the entire experience made the occasion truly special. This place sets a benchmark for dining in Lebanon. Highly recommended.

topReviews.author: William Radiyeh
topReviews.text:
Had a fantastic Christmas lunch at Tom & Mutz yesterday! The ambiance was spot on, the Christmas decorations were fancy and aesthetic, and the music was at the perfect volume to still enjoy conversation.

Our waiter, Chris, was incredibly hospitable and attentive throughout the meal. Food-wise, the Margherita pizza is a classic that I have to get every time I visit, and the pasta was equally delicious.

They added some really thoughtful holiday touches: a Santa visited a nearby table with gifts in a very classy, non-intrusive way, and we even got to choose a Christmas-themed candle to take home (I picked the gingerbread man!). Excellent quality at very reasonable prices. 5/5 would always recommend for Italian food in Beirut! üîù

topReviews.author: Maya Farhat
topReviews.text:
Well recommended! The food is excellent ( seafood risotto is a must if you‚Äôre a fan). The pizza and bread dough is insane and the service was top (thanks to our waiter Chris)
Love the aesthetics too. A great place for an enjoyable meal.

name: Chouwen lake
description: Chouwen Lake is not just a picturesque destination for nature lovers; it also features a lovely restaurant where visitors can savor delicious meals with stunning views of the water. Perfect for a day of hiking and relaxation, this spot offers a unique combination of outdoor adventure and delightful dining, making it a favorite retreat for those seeking tranquility in nature.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit during the spring or fall for pleasant weather and to enjoy the vibrant colors surrounding the lake.
localTip: Pack a picnic to enjoy by the lake; the serene environment enhances any meal!
scamWarning: Be cautious of unofficial guides offering boat rides; always opt for licensed services for safety.

topReviews.author: Sami KHOURY
topReviews.text: An excellent place for hiking in the middle of a wild nature. An average of 1h 45min easy hike to reach Chouwen Lake. Great views of the lake.

topReviews.author: Zhuorui Fu
topReviews.text: They don‚Äôt allow dogs. Very weird. Claiming that all lands are private. What? Here they privatise lake? The worst. The could‚Äôve stated on their website instead of us travelling for one hr in the mountain arriving only be told dog now allowed bc dog may bother other pedestrians. Weirdest thing. How many hiking trails in the nature in the world do not allow both dogs and humans? It‚Äôs nature bro it‚Äôs not a museum or house you own at home. And we came on a rainy day there was no human beings on trail and they said the dog bothers pedestrians. Just check what you say and may be you will laugh from your words too.

topReviews.author: Amale Haber
topReviews.text: Chouen Lake is a magnificent and magical spot in the heart of the mountains. The green, chill waters are simply stunning. We parked our cars and went on a 45-minute hike surrounded by trees, always accompanied by the soothing sound of the river. The trail is safe and well maintained, though not very easy for kids. We ended up spending a wonderful afternoon hiking and even swimming in the cold, refreshing river water‚Äîa truly memorable experience.

address: Chouwen lake after, 3QG9+2P6 from Nahr Brahim, Ÿäÿ≠ÿ¥Ÿàÿ¥ÿå Lebanon

name: Caf√© Badaro
description: Tucked away in a charming neighborhood, Caf√© Badaro is a delightful spot where locals gather to enjoy a fusion of traditional Lebanese dishes and modern cuisine. The cozy ambiance and attentive service make it the perfect place to unwind after a day of exploring. With its eclectic decor and inviting atmosphere, you'll find yourself lingering over a cup of coffee or a delicious meal, discovering the flavors that make Lebanese food so special.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit during the late afternoon when the sun sets, casting a warm glow over the caf√©'s terrace.
localTip: Don't miss their homemade desserts, especially the baklava, which pairs beautifully with their strong Lebanese coffee.
scamWarning: Be cautious of street vendors near the caf√© who may try to sell fake souvenirs; instead, opt for authentic items from reputable shops.

topReviews.author: cute panda
topReviews.text: Wow just wow. Really nice place. It wasn't planned at all. Me and my friend were just passing by when we saw so many cute cats sitting on the chairs outside, we couldn't help it and went to pet them, but then we saw the place and got curious so we went in. It was so pretty and spacious. I asked for the prices first. They had it on a link and a paper, they also have wife. The prices were good so we sat down. Ordered some drinks, chatted and worked. It's so comfy to sit i almost fell asleep the table are big. The atmosphere was nice. No loud noises or bad music. The hot chocolate is so delicious I wasn't expecting that. My friend ordered the smoothie it was pretty good. The waiter was so nice. And the best part every now and then we took a break and went to pet the cats ü•πüíï. Best place ever.

topReviews.author: Dahlia Kh
topReviews.text: Badaro Caf√© is hands down one of my favorite Lebanese restaurants. I‚Äôve been coming here for years, whether with my parents or friends, and it never disappoints. The food is consistently delicious and always on point, while the service is impressively quick. The seating is so comfortable, making it the perfect place to relax and enjoy a meal. I always recommend this spot to everyone‚Äîit truly stands out!

topReviews.author: Amir Habboub
topReviews.text:
Very nice atmosphere
Cheap prices

name: The Terrible Prince
description: As the name suggests, The Terrible Prince is anything but terrible! This quaint wine bar offers an impressive selection of local wines and a cozy atmosphere that invites you to relax and enjoy the finer things in life. The combination of thoughtful pairings and delicious small plates makes it a must-visit for any wine enthusiast looking to immerse themselves in Lebanon's rich culinary culture.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings are the best time to experience the vibrant atmosphere and enjoy live music on weekends.
localTip: Ask the staff for their wine recommendations; they're knowledgeable and can guide you to some hidden treasures.
scamWarning: Be aware of overly eager promoters outside, as they might lead you to places that don't match their descriptions.

topReviews.author: Carlie Iskandar
topReviews.text:
My new go-to spot for an early dinner and drinks. Burger is absolutely delicious ; paired with fabulous and original drinks. Not to miss!
Also usually not a fan of tarama, but this one hit the spot :)

topReviews.author: Burger Layover
topReviews.text:
@burgerlayover
This one‚Äôs a real back-to-basics kind of burger. A soft bun, a juicy beef patty cooked with just the right amount of char, melty American cheese draped over the edges, and a few pickles for that sharp bite. Nothing over the top, no unnecessary frills, just a straightforward cheeseburger that lets the beef and cheese do the talking.

The cut down the middle makes it feel almost diner-style, easy to share (if you really want to). Flavor-wise, it‚Äôs that nostalgic combo of savory, salty, cheesy, and tangy that instantly takes you back to your first bite of a classic cheeseburger. Sometimes simplicity is the biggest flex.
A solid ‚Äúless is more‚Äù burger.

Captain Thomas is an amazing guy. Very easy to talk to and professional at the same time. He is a gem in his industry.

The only thing I didn‚Äôt like but not related to the stars is their reservation system. It‚Äôs an hassle so good lucküòÖ

topReviews.author: Karine Jazra
topReviews.text: My favorite go-to spot whenever I‚Äôm in Beirut. Their burgers are hands down some of the best in the city ‚Äî juicy, flavorful, and perfectly balanced in every bite. But what really surprised me was their tomato salad: simple yet elevated, with fresh tomatoes and just the right seasoning that makes it unforgettable. The consistency is also worth mentioning ‚Äî every visit feels just as good as the last, which is rare

name: The Wooden Cellar
description: Nestled in the heart of the city, The Wooden Cellar is a cozy Italian restaurant that feels like a warm embrace the moment you step inside. Its rustic charm and welcoming atmosphere set the stage for a culinary experience that showcases the best of Italian flavors made with local ingredients. Perfect for family dinners or intimate gatherings, you'll find that every dish is crafted with love and attention to detail, transporting you straight to Italy.
bestTimeToVisit: Dinner time is ideal, when the soft lighting enhances the restaurant's inviting ambiance.
localTip: Try their homemade pasta; it's a specialty that many patrons rave about.
scamWarning: Avoid accepting unsolicited offers for discounts from strangers outside the restaurant, as they may not be legitimate.

topReviews.author: chef chantelly Nassif
topReviews.text: ‚ú® we went to Wooden Cellar in Hazmieh today and it was more than perfect. The Christmas decoration felt like a little piece of Amsterdam ‚Äî full of red, bows, and magical festive details everywhere. The atmosphere was on another level with the amazing singer(rania abou samra), who made the night even more special. And the Italian food‚Ä¶ absolutely delicious, every dish better than the next. A must-visit this Christmas season!‚Äù üéÑ‚ù§Ô∏èüçù‚ú®

topReviews.author: Nada Jreissati
topReviews.text:
The atmosphere at The Wooden Cellar is cozy and stylish ‚Äî with a rustic charm that suits different occasions. The night we visited featured an Italian music performance, which added a lively and memorable touch to the evening.

Service was excellent. The entire place was managed by one waiter who handled everything with impressive efficiency. His deep knowledge of wine stood out ‚Äî something rarely seen nowadays and much appreciated.

The food was good overall. The cheese and charcuterie board could use improvement, especially the portioning of cold cuts, which felt noticeably limited. A better balance here would elevate the offering.

Still, it‚Äôs a lovely spot in Beirut, and worth visiting ‚Äî especially if you catch one of their themed nights.

topReviews.author: Naeem ‚ÄúNix‚Äù
topReviews.text: Absolutely loved this place! The pizza was delicious, the wine perfectly paired, and the atmosphere was so warm and inviting. The staff were incredibly polite and the service was outstanding ‚Äî truly a wonderful experience! üçïüç∑‚ú®

name: Mounir
description: Mounir is a beloved local restaurant celebrated for its authentic Lebanese cuisine and friendly atmosphere. This hidden gem offers a diverse menu filled with traditional dishes, all prepared with fresh ingredients and time-honored recipes. Whether you're indulging in grilled meats, creamy hummus, or fragrant rice dishes, Mounir promises an unforgettable dining experience that captures the essence of Lebanon's rich culinary heritage.
bestTimeToVisit: Lunch hours are perfect for a relaxed meal, enjoying the lively buzz of the local crowd.
localTip: Be sure to try the mezze platter to sample a variety of flavors in one go.
scamWarning: Steer clear of unofficial taxi services that might approach you outside, as they can overcharge for rides.

topReviews.author: Sarah Saleh
topReviews.text: Never disappoints! Fresh garden picked tomatoes. The best Lebanese food! Dishes are consistent and great attentive service. The atmosphere is relaxing with great views, it‚Äôs spacious and has a playground. Surrounded by greenery and flowers.

topReviews.author: Zeina El Zein
topReviews.text:
One of the best lebanese restaurants. It never disappoints.

The staff are very friendly and welcoming. The food from mezze to bbq is tasty.

topReviews.author: Charles BM
topReviews.text:
Mounir Mounir Mounir....
Everyone makes you feel unwelcome, from the person you speak to on the phone, to the waiter, to the coffee server.

name: La Cr√™perie
description: La Cr√™perie is a delightful culinary escape where the charm of French cr√™pes meets the warmth of Lebanese hospitality. This cozy eatery is perfect for a casual meal or a sweet treat, offering a variety of both savory and sweet cr√™pes that cater to all tastes. With its inviting d√©cor and friendly staff, La Cr√™perie becomes not just a meal stop but a cherished memory of your time in Lebanon.
bestTimeToVisit: Late afternoon or early evening is ideal, when you can enjoy a cr√™pe with a refreshing drink.
localTip: Don't pass up the chance to try their Nutella cr√™pe; it's a crowd favorite!
scamWarning: Be cautious of random individuals offering food deals near the restaurant, as they might not be trustworthy.

topReviews.author: Dr. Nahil KAZOUN
topReviews.text:
Excellent choice when in Jounieh to enjoy your tast lunch/dinner with the lovely sea view.

Kind staff and fair prices.
Enjoy!

topReviews.author: Selim Srour
topReviews.text:
Absolutely phenomenal experience! From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was warm, authentic, and inviting. The service was impeccable‚Äîattentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu.

As for the food‚Äîwow! Every dish was a masterpiece. Fresh ingredients, beautifully presented, and bursting with flavor. It‚Äôs clear that great care and passion go into every plate.

This place truly delivers the full experience: ambiance, service, and top-tier Japanese cuisine. Highly recommended. Deserves every one of its 5 stars!

topReviews.author: Christine Habib
topReviews.text: Dear Cr√™perie, im gonna say it in Arabic: ¬´¬† baddna nshedd 7alna¬†¬ª. Used to be my favorite restaurant in Jounieh but every time I visit now, something happens and makes me change my mind. Today I had to wait one hour for my steak frites, while we were only 2 tables and there was no crowd.

name: Restaurant Joseph
description: Nestled in the heart of Lebanon, Restaurant Joseph is a delightful hidden gem that serves up flavorful Middle Eastern fast food, perfect for those on the go. With a cozy atmosphere and a menu brimming with local specialties, this establishment has quickly gained popularity among locals and tourists alike. Whether you're craving a quick bite or a full meal, you'll be treated to authentic Lebanese flavors that are sure to satisfy your palate.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings during weekdays, when the local crowd is low and the ambiance is relaxed.
localTip: Try their shawarma wrap, it‚Äôs a crowd favorite and comes highly recommended by regulars.
scamWarning: Be cautious of street vendors nearby who may offer similar dishes at inflated prices; always dine in established restaurants for quality.

topReviews.author: Tarek Bekdache
topReviews.text: Disappointed with the service on my visit. The cashier was rude and unwelcoming‚Äîvery unlike the warm Lebanese hospitality one usually expects. I ordered the chicken shawarma sandwich. While the portion of chicken was generous, the sandwich overall didn‚Äôt meet expectations. The chicken was juicy and flavorful but was a tad cold. the sandwich wasn't toasted enough which took away from the flavor and experience.

topReviews.author: GabsyK
topReviews.text: Stopped by Joseph in Sin El Fil for lunch and it was a great idea! I tried both the chicken shawarma and the beef shawarma ‚Äî absolutely delicious, packed with flavor, and perfectly balanced. It‚Äôs a quick and casual spot, but the food is on another level. Definitely worth the visit if you‚Äôre craving authentic, mouthwatering sandwiches!

topReviews.author: Afif Banna
topReviews.text: I honestly don‚Äôt get where all the fuss is coming from. Joseph‚Äôs Shawarma is definitely one of the better ones I‚Äôve had üçó The quality of the chicken is excellent, flavorful, and clearly fresh. But when you factor in the long wait times ‚è≥ and the price üí∏ it really starts to lose its charm. The portion size is quite underwhelming for what you pay and how long you wait. It‚Äôs good, yes ‚Äî but not that good. Worth a try if you‚Äôre curious, but don‚Äôt expect a life-changing sandwich ü•ô

name: Saigon Vietnamese & Chinese Cuisine
description: Saigon Vietnamese & Chinese Cuisine offers a unique culinary experience that transports diners to Southeast Asia without leaving Lebanon. This charming restaurant features an inviting ambiance and an extensive menu filled with authentic dishes. From flavorful pho to crispy spring rolls, each plate is prepared with fresh ingredients and a touch of love, making it a perfect spot for food enthusiasts looking to explore beyond traditional Lebanese cuisine.
bestTimeToVisit: Lunch hours on weekends, when the restaurant is less crowded and the service is prompt.
localTip: Don't miss their signature pho; it's a must-try for any visitor looking for a hearty meal.
scamWarning: Avoid accepting unsolicited offers from street food vendors claiming to sell similar dishes; stick to established restaurants for safety.

topReviews.author: Jesus A
topReviews.text: Like many places today, they‚Äôve become part of the shrinkflation trend. I used to always order the chicken pho with extra chicken, and my partner would get the beef pho. After trying the pho this time, we noticed the portions were smaller and much lighter with less noodles and noticeably less meat. Even with the extra chicken I ordered, it still felt like less than before. We also ordered the Vietnamese Shrimp Eggrolls and the regular eggrolls. These used to come with four pieces each, but we only received two per order. The prices have gone up, yet the portions have clearly gone down. For context, the last time I visited was back on Mother‚Äôs Day, and the portions were perfectly fine. A few months later, the serving sizes have shrunk while the cost has increased. The waiter is friendly, but it‚Äôs always the same person working alone. Because of that, the service is slow. Expect to spend about 1.5 to 2 hours here depending on how busy the restaurant is.

topReviews.author: 1976MonaLisa
topReviews.text: The food is incredible! They are currently very understaffed, which is unfortunate, but the delicious food is worth the wait. Do not go if you are in a rush. If you can sit and enjoy your meal and your companions, it is wonderful. The minimal staff they do have are so sweet and helpful! I have tried and loved the pho, the crab rangoons, biscuits, cashew chicken, and fried rice. Scrumptious!

topReviews.author: A D
topReviews.text:
This wonderful restaurant has been around for a long time, but off my beaten path, so I forget about it, but it's not to be missed anymore, as it's become a fave! It's located in a small plaza where few businesses remain, but they have plenty of customers and an attached gaming parlor with gambling machines in a separate room - it's nice that they separate it from the family seating (you've got to be 21 to enter).

The food is amazing. We have some favorite Chinese places, so we went straight for the Vietnamese foods and they didn't disappoint! For appetizers, we order #101, Vietnamese egg rolls - simple and delicious with some amazing sauce that marries the flavors together and #103 Vietnamese spring rolls, which we do vegetarian, so veggies wrapped in rice paper, served cold with great peanut flavored sauce. For entrees, we love #140 Vegetarian pan-seared RICE noodles - they are thick and dense noodles with the crispiness of the pan sear, topped with vegetables, tofu and a brown sauce we've recently been asking them to make it spicy and it hits the spot every time - perfect heat for the dish, not overwhelming and no lingering burn. We also ordered #117 Special Vermicelli that came with shrimp, pork, chicken, and veggies over super thin noodles, which my adult son described as "quite tasty" and he'd "definitely order it again."

We placed orders by phone and we are promptly greeted upon arrival and checked out in no time - staff is very friendly and takes time to answer questions, explain dishes and make future recommendations. I believe it was the owner that came out and interacted today, which emphasizes why these small restaurants thrive - they get to know the community they serve and make you feel welcome, sharing their cuisines and growing our palettes. Give them a shot, you won't be disappointed!

name: Coop d'√©tat rooftop
description: Perched above the bustling streets, Coop d'√©tat rooftop is a trendy bar and restaurant that offers stunning views of the city skyline, making it an ideal spot for an evening out. With a creative cocktail menu and a selection of delectable small plates, this rooftop hideaway invites you to unwind and enjoy a vibrant atmosphere. It's the perfect place to catch up with friends or enjoy a romantic evening under the stars.
bestTimeToVisit: Sunset hours for breathtaking views and a lively ambiance as the city lights begin to twinkle.
localTip: Arrive early to secure a good seat with the best view; the rooftop can fill up quickly, especially on weekends.
scamWarning: Be wary of unofficial taxi services near popular areas; always use a reputable ride-sharing app or call a trusted taxi service.

topReviews.author: Marwan Haddad
topReviews.text:
Very nice and casual place in gemayzeh above em nazzih.
the music is excellent.
We always enjoy our time.
They offer drinks and food, and they are very affordable .
Great place to enjoy your Friday or Saturday  evening.

topReviews.author: Yvonne Rudman
topReviews.text: I loved how cozy the atmosphere was. Prices were most affordable and the staff complimented the experience.

topReviews.author: Cero cyka
topReviews.text:
It was a bit tricky to find this place since I was not familiar with the area, you have to go in an alley wat that leads to a building where you have to go up using the stairs about 5 stories.
A great place/rooftop for a get together with some friends, it is a bit loud for a couple (date).

name: Taanayel
description: Taanayel is a quaint eatery that offers a glimpse into the local culinary scene, blending traditional Lebanese flavors with contemporary twists. This charming spot is perfect for those seeking an authentic experience away from the tourist crowds. Each dish tells a story of Lebanon‚Äôs rich culinary heritage, making it a delightful find for food lovers eager to explore.
bestTimeToVisit: Weekdays for a more tranquil dining experience, allowing you to savor each dish without rush.
localTip: Ask about their daily specials, as they often feature seasonal ingredients and unique creations.
scamWarning: Avoid engaging with aggressive sales tactics from nearby vendors; always inquire within the restaurant for accurate information on their offerings.

name: COUQLEY
description: COUQLEY is a delightful fusion of French and Lebanese cuisine, offering a unique dining experience that caters to both locals and tourists. With a cozy setting and a menu that features everything from exquisite pastries to hearty main courses, this restaurant is perfect for food lovers seeking something different. The attention to detail and commitment to quality make every meal a memorable one.
bestTimeToVisit: Late afternoons for a leisurely lunch, when the atmosphere is relaxed and perfect for enjoying their gourmet offerings.
localTip: Be sure to try their signature desserts; they are known for their exceptional pastries that are a feast for both the eyes and the palate.
scamWarning: Stick to ordering from the menu to avoid any surprises; some places may attempt to upsell items that are not worth the cost.

topReviews.author: Reem Wahoud
topReviews.text: Couqley is a lovely French bistro with a great location and wonderful vibes. The food is really good, and they offer a nice selection of wines. The service is excellent and the welcome is warm. It‚Äôs a very cozy restaurant, especially in winter and the food is simply delicious.

topReviews.author: Charbel kajouni
topReviews.text:
We arrived at Cookley around 9:30. The hostess approached us and politely asked us to wait until our table was cleaned.

After we were seated, we tried calling two waiters, but they ignored us and acted as if they didn‚Äôt see us. Eventually, a waiter came and took our order: chicken, beef, and duck (three dishes).

The beef and duck arrived, and we ate and finished them. When the chicken still hadn‚Äôt arrived, we called another waiter to ask about it. I clearly told him that if the chicken had not been ordered, to cancel it. He insisted that it was on the way and would take four more minutes‚Äîdespite the fact that we had ordered it over 30 minutes earlier, and took 10 additional minutes. it was obvious it hadn‚Äôt been placed.

Overall, the food was good, but the service was below average, especially considering the large number of staff on the floor. I would recommend the Dbayeh branch instead for better service.

The ironic part was when I asked for the check, and a waiter made a joke about how ‚Äúthe fastest thing we have is the bill.‚Äù I paid and left.

I expected much better service from a place like this.

topReviews.author: Ziad Selfani
topReviews.text: Nice French bistro tucked in a small alley friendly staff delicious meals cooked to perfection. A must try for meat and French cuisine lovers.

name: MIM Mineral Museum
description: Nestled in the heart of Beirut, the MIM Mineral Museum is a captivating hidden gem that showcases an impressive collection of minerals and geological specimens from around the world. Its stunning displays and engaging exhibits make it an enlightening stop for both locals and tourists alike, offering an artistic glimpse into the natural beauty of our planet. Don't miss the chance to explore the unique mineral formations and learn about the geological marvels of Lebanon and beyond.
bestTimeToVisit: The museum is best visited during weekdays when it is less crowded, allowing for a more intimate experience with the exhibits.
localTip: Take a moment to chat with the knowledgeable staff, who can provide fascinating insights and stories about the minerals on display.
scamWarning: Be cautious of unofficial tour guides outside the museum who may offer misleading information or charge exorbitant fees.

topReviews.author: Jad S
topReviews.text: Went on a Sunday afternoon. No wait time, and entry was donation based. Staff was super friendly. The museum is modern, well marked, and spotless. The exhibits are stunning and it‚Äôs incredible that all of them were part of a private collection. There‚Äôs a nice video illustration that explains why fossil stones exist in Lebanon. The museum is the basement level, whereas the gift shop is on the first floor. They have an elevator as well as stairs. Overall, highly recommend this museum especially if you just finished visiting the national museum of Beirut.

topReviews.author: yujin haidar
topReviews.text: had such a fun time here! there are so many crystals from all around the world, and you can even see some fossils and really unique pieces inside. the security staff were honestly so kind! one of them even took time to explain things. i don‚Äôt get why some reviews say they‚Äôre rude, because everyone was super friendly. entry is free, though they do accept donations, and the only rule is no flash photography. you can easily spend a couple of hours just walking around and enjoying everything.

topReviews.author: Layla Mansour
topReviews.text: An insanely beautiful museum. Already planning my next visit. Words can't express the level of awe at seeing these products of the natural world which seem impossible. The fact that they even have 4 pieces of meteorite rock was the cherry on top. Would have never expected to see such amazing pieces especially not in a museum with free entrance. It's highly understated and I would recommend you move this to the top of the list of places you need to see while visiting, or even when living, in the country.

address: Universit√© Saint-Joseph Campus de L'innovation et du Sport (CIS),ÿå Bayrut, Lebanon

name: Ramen-ya
description: Ramen-ya is a delightful treasure tucked away in the vibrant streets of Lebanon, where authentic Japanese flavors come to life in a cozy and inviting atmosphere. This hidden gem specializes in crafting delicious, steaming bowls of ramen that will transport your taste buds straight to Japan, with rich broths and fresh ingredients that keep locals returning for more. Whether you're a ramen aficionado or trying it for the first time, Ramen-ya is sure to satisfy your cravings.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit during weekday lunch hours for a quieter experience and to enjoy their special lunch menu.
localTip: Don't miss out on their seasonal ramen specials that feature unique ingredients and flavors.
scamWarning: Be wary of street vendors who may offer imitation ramen experiences; head straight to Ramen-ya for the real deal.

topReviews.author: Ricky Dakouny
topReviews.text: Tucked in the heart of Beirut, Ramenya has become my go-to ramen refuge. It‚Äôs central yet feels hiden, warm, cozy, and effortlessly authentic. Their 12-hour rich broth is what sets it apart: deep, comforting, and layered with flavor in every sip. Whether you‚Äôre escaping the city rush or chasing that perfect noodle bowl, this little gem always hits the spot. üçú‚ú®

topReviews.author: Afif Banna
topReviews.text:
Oh. My. God. I almost jumped out of my seat that‚Äôs how good it was.
The chicken katsu curry was out of this world, and the ramen? So, so good.

Slightly on the expensive side ; it is not overpriced, just a bit up there. But honestly, worth every penny.
Friendly staff, cozy vibe, great experience overall. Will definitely be coming back.

topReviews.author: The diary guide
topReviews.text:
A very nice place. I loved the Ramen‚Äîthe portions are generous and they are very fair with the ingredients they put inside. The staff were welcoming, well-behaved, and provided good service.

My only negative note is that it was a bit cold inside. Also, as a small suggestion, adding some Japanese-style music would really complete the vibe and transport you to the right atmosphere. It‚Äôs a small place, but definitely a good experience.

name: L'Autre Bistro
description: L'Autre Bistro is a charming culinary hideaway that blends Italian and French influences, offering a unique dining experience in Lebanon. With its warm ambiance and exquisite menu, this hidden gem serves up a delightful array of wine, pasta, and gourmet dishes that are both delicious and beautifully presented. Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner or a casual meal with friends, L'Autre Bistro promises an unforgettable gastronomic journey.

localTip: Pair your meal with a glass of wine from their carefully curated selection to enhance your dining experience.
scamWarning: Always check the menu prices before ordering, as some nearby establishments may try to charge inflated prices for similar dishes.

topReviews.author: Firas Jarrah
topReviews.text:
The most underrated restaurant in beirut, Hamra(no doubt) and arguably in Lebanon. From the quality, to service to the cool atmosphere‚Ä¶ every time i visit Beirut, this is definitely on my to do list.
Note: I dunno how to take good pictures of food üòÖ and most plates were done before having the chance

topReviews.author: Bahaa Malaeb
topReviews.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my time at this restaurant. The staff were highly professional, guiding us through the menu and making sure we had everything we needed. The food was delicious, with each dish carefully prepared and beautifully presented. The atmosphere was comfortable and elegant, which made our evening very enjoyable. This is a place I will happily recommend to others.

topReviews.author: Ahmad Rammal
topReviews.text: One of the best Italian‚ÄìFrench restaurants in Beirut.

address: Makhoul Street Secteur 34, El, Rue 77, ÿ®Ÿäÿ±Ÿàÿ™ÿå Lebanon

name: New Indo-Lanka Restaurant
description: New Indo-Lanka Restaurant is a vibrant spot that brings the rich culinary traditions of Sri Lanka and India right to your plate. With its vibrant decor and aromatic dishes, this hidden gem is perfect for those seeking an authentic taste experience. From flavorful curries to freshly made breads, every dish is prepared with care and attention to detail, making it a haven for food lovers looking to explore new flavors.

localTip: Try their signature dishes like the Sri Lankan curry, which are often made with traditional spices and recipes.
scamWarning: Be cautious of overly aggressive street solicitors promoting nearby restaurants; stick with New Indo-Lanka for an authentic experience.

topReviews.author: Sanjeev Kumar Mandal
topReviews.text:
Authentic, flavorful, and inexpensive Indian/Sri Lankan food.
‚ÄãFriendly service.

topReviews.author: V√°clav Pavl√≠k
topReviews.text: Really nice and cheap restaurant. There are bo prices at all but we paid less than USD30 for 4 persons. The owner is very kind and speaks English. The entrance is by the stairs at the grocery shop. Not luxury place but the best when you want to eat proper dish.

topReviews.author: Zahraa Mourtada
topReviews.text:
the place was FILTHY. the waiter‚Äôs nails were yellowish/green/black.

the chicken lollipops were the only edible things. the texture of everything was off, and the taste of badly cooked eggs (mezenkheen) just HITS you as soon as you try the biryani rice.

the service however was perfect, and the place is SO CHEAP????  i would like it to be cleaner though.

definitely won‚Äôt be going to the restaurant ever again since i was nauseous the whole day after eating, but i would visit their shop. they have a lot of exotic products.

name: Choc en Bouche
description: Choc en Bouche is a delightful dessert shop that feels like a sweet escape right in the heart of Lebanon. Specializing in exquisite pastries and confections, this hidden gem is perfect for anyone with a sweet tooth, offering a range of delectable treats from macarons to artisanal chocolates. The charming ambiance and friendly staff make it an inviting spot to indulge in your favorite desserts or to enjoy a cozy coffee break.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit in the late afternoon to enjoy their freshly baked goods paired with a cup of coffee as a perfect afternoon treat.
localTip: Be sure to try their signature dessert, the chocolate √©clair, which is a local favorite and often recommended by regulars.
scamWarning: Avoid purchasing chocolates from street vendors, as they may not offer the same quality and freshness as Choc en Bouche.

topReviews.author: Lea Azar
topReviews.text: Choc en Bouche did an incredible job at my friend‚Äôs engagement! Their presentation was stunning, so elegant and professional. The chocolates and desserts were absolutely delicious, truly the best in the business. They‚Äôre generous, have amazing taste, and every detail was perfect. I was super satisfied and would definitely recommend them!

topReviews.author: Lory Zadikian
topReviews.text: We order from Choc en Bouche for every special occasion, and there‚Äôs a reason. Amazing flavors, beautiful presentation, and the most complimented dessert on the table. Their desserts are always the highlight of our celebrations and the first thing to disappear. Can‚Äôt recommend them enough!

topReviews.author: Elsa Meg
topReviews.text: We've been ordering for all our occasions it's been 2 years and we're never disappointed! I can assure she's number 1 in lebanon!

name: Burgundy Restaurant
description: Nestled in the heart of Lebanon, Burgundy Restaurant is a culinary treasure that delights food lovers with its exquisite Mediterranean dishes and warm, inviting atmosphere. This hidden gem is known for its innovative fusion of traditional flavors and contemporary presentation, making each dish a work of art. Whether you are a local or a traveler, the charming decor and attentive service will ensure a memorable dining experience.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings during the summer months for a lively ambiance.
localTip: Try their signature mezze platter to sample a variety of authentic flavors.
scamWarning: Be cautious of street vendors nearby who may offer inflated prices for food items.

topReviews.author: Salted Caramel
topReviews.text: One restaurant in Lebanon that is worthy of being on the Michelin Guide in my opinion is Burgundy. The ingredients used are of the highest caliber and the chef pays attention to details. The items on the plate are meticulously displayed in an appealing way that makes you not want to touch them. However, then you think of how appetizing they seem and you know you have to have a taste. I have visited Burgundy twice and both times the food was delicious. The in-house smoked salmon appears to be done being smoked right in front of you on the table when the cover is removed and the salmon is revealed under the cloudiness. The salads are filled with flavor and the mashed potato served with the steak is silky smooth. It was the first time I had ever tasted a soft-shell crab and it was an interesting experience for a person with arachnophobia. We had a selection of cheese before the dessert. I am a person that really likes cheese so I enjoyed that platter. I also loved the chutney provided with the cheese; I adore the marriage of taste that cheese and chutney create in my mouth. The desserts were delectable, especially the chocolate souffle. I think molten chocolate is one of the greatest creations ever made. Actually, writing this blog post now makes me want to go to Burgundy again very soon.

topReviews.author: Joey AL-Hachach
topReviews.text: Burgundy is a restaurant that takes the dining experience to a whole new level, the decor and ambiance are perfect, the staff is one of the best and very friendly, as for the food Chef Youssef Akiki is an expert that never fails to impress. I can‚Äôt say that anything I tried was less than exceptional.

topReviews.author: Joseph Kazzi
topReviews.text: Cozy place, fantastic French Menu, great wine, very friendly team and excellent service.

name: Uncle Fluffy City Center
description: Uncle Fluffy City Center is a cozy spot that brings a unique twist to the cafe experience in Lebanon, offering a delightful selection of coffee and pastries in a charming setting. This hidden gem is perfect for a leisurely afternoon or a quick pick-me-up, with a menu that features both local specialties and international favorites. The friendly staff and inviting atmosphere make it a great place to unwind and recharge.
bestTimeToVisit: Mid-afternoon for a quieter atmosphere and fresh pastry selections.
localTip: Don't miss out on their homemade cakes, which are a local favorite.
scamWarning: Beware of unofficial guides offering tours around the area; stick to recognized services.

topReviews.author: Mike Aoun
topReviews.text: So uncle fluffy famously have the japanese cheesecake, but what i loved the most at this branch is the staff, we needed to weite something on the cake and they got creative with the task so we could have our wish. They have also a small seating area.

topReviews.author: Rafik Kazoun
topReviews.text:
Delicious Japanese cheesecake!
Had the half nutella and lotus one.
Quick service. Good prices.

topReviews.author: Roy S.
topReviews.text: If you like the spongy cakes then this is your destination

name: Al jamal
description: Al jamal stands out as a hidden gem in the Lebanese dining scene, renowned for its authentic flavors and homely feel. This restaurant is perfect for those looking to indulge in traditional Lebanese cuisine, where every dish is prepared with care and the freshest ingredients. The vibrant ambiance and friendly staff create a welcoming environment that invites guests to linger and savor every bite.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings during weekends for a lively dining experience.
localTip: Order the grilled meats; they are a highlight and highly recommended by locals.
scamWarning: Avoid accepting unsolicited offers of transportation from strangers outside the restaurant.

topReviews.author: nour haddad
topReviews.text:
Not ur usual seafood place!
Authentic, vibrant, different...
It s actually an old house build on the sea...
Fresh calamri to die for! Grilled buttery fish with fattouche and fries on the side

topReviews.author: Houssam El Zein
topReviews.text: Nice pool bar; the staff are very friendly, service is good. The DJ was decent as well.

topReviews.author: Ahmad Yahya
topReviews.text:
One of the best beaches in lebanon!
I went there for a week and i fed turtles!
Yes turtles!
They come to the seashore everyday at 5pm amd people feed them, they give them lettuce usually!
I swam with the turtles there and got awesome pictures for them and for other fishes!
And i can't forget the awesome fokd they serve!
And you can also get your own fish out of the al jamal sea and give it to the kitchen there so they cook it for you!
Isn't that awesome!
Check the photos below!

name: Hanna Mitri Ice Cream
description: Hanna Mitri Ice Cream is a beloved institution in Lebanon, where the art of ice cream making is taken to new heights. This hidden gem is famous for its rich and creamy flavors, crafted from the finest ingredients, and has been cherished by locals for generations. Whether you're looking for a refreshing treat on a hot day or a sweet end to your meal, this ice cream shop promises to delight with each scoop.
bestTimeToVisit: Summer evenings when the outdoor seating is perfect for enjoying your treat.
localTip: Be sure to try their unique flavors like rose and mastic that you won't find elsewhere.
scamWarning: Watch out for people selling knock-off desserts near popular tourist spots.

topReviews.author: Antoun Boustani
topReviews.text: After I heard so many amazing reviews about this place, I stopped by to give it a try. In my opinion, this is the best place to do local ice cream in the traditional way, but the competition with other places will not be fair. The flavors were rich, but I didn't find any special flavor except the croquet and pistachio. The prices are really high, too expensive for an ice cream cup. It was a good experience.

topReviews.author: Luc√≠a Acebillo
topReviews.text: Best ice cream! The pistachio flavor had big chunks inside and the strawberry was tasty and refreshing! Definitely will come back!

topReviews.author: Sara Salem
topReviews.text: Tried the croquant and pistachio and they were out of this world really stunning and delicious,lots of flavors

name: Avanti
description: Avanti offers a delightful escape into the world of Italian cuisine right in the heart of Lebanon. This hidden gem is known for its authentic pasta dishes and wood-fired pizzas, all made with love and the finest ingredients. The warm ambiance and attentive service create a perfect setting for families and friends to gather, making it an ideal choice for a cozy meal or a celebratory dinner.
bestTimeToVisit: Weeknights for a more relaxed dining experience.
localTip: Pair your meal with one of their excellent local wines for a complete experience.

Pizza Is Fair, pasta the One i ate which is with Pesto not so good at all, the pasta quality.
All in all, not bad

name: Happy hazmieh
description: Nestled in the heart of Hazmieh, Happy hazmieh offers a delightful blend of traditional Lebanese dishes and modern culinary creations, making it a must-visit for food enthusiasts. topReviews.author: Imad Bazzi
topReviews.text: The place is good, if you shop smart you can save some good deal of money, however brands and options can be very limited,  there might be only one shelf for the item you are looking for so you better keep your eyes open. some items are super cheap, while others can be very expensive. relatively speaking, alcohol and meat / chicken are a bit cheaper, vegetables as well. but again the issue with limitation of brands is annoying. Try their fresh bread it is great.

topReviews.author: Hisham Malla
topReviews.text:
Worst service ever. I'm writing this review after taking a decision not to shop at Happy. I bought multiple things including milk powder. There was a clear sign that the price is 1,299,999 LL. After paying, I was checking the receipt at my car and found that the price charged is 1,454,999 LL. My wife returned to them to check and resolve this. Almost 30 minutes went with my wife still in there. My baby is crying in the car. It was a nightmare. I called my wife and she said im still dealing with customer service. I was furious, took my daughter and went down there to talk to them.
They said that the offer has ended and the price changed. Knowing the price on the product was still 1,299,999 LL.
No appology, I said I dont want the product anymore.
And we took a refund and left.
Happy should teach their employees how to deal with customers.
You have lost a customer and more will follow.

name: KAHWET 60 (Sa√Øda)
description: KAHWET 60 in Sa√Øda is a delightful spot that captures the essence of Lebanese caf√© culture with its charming decor and inviting atmosphere. Serving a variety of traditional Lebanese dishes, this restaurant not only offers delectable meals but also a wonderful view of the Mediterranean, making it the perfect place to relax and unwind.
