topReviews.author: Lina Mesilmany
topReviews.text:
We had a very nice and delicious brunch. Everything was a gem in a nutshell.
Despite the authentic food and very nice and appreciated service. We would like to acknowledge and give credits to one of the waiters ‚ÄúYoussef‚Äù he was very authentic and gentleman with our one year old baby. He gave him alot of attention, effort and kindness, which we very much appreciated!

topReviews.author: Mohamad Younes
topReviews.text: Kahwet 60 is a beautiful spot with vintage Lebanese charm and amazing sea views. The food is delicious, the coffee is great, and the atmosphere is perfect for relaxing. Staff are friendly and service is excellent. Highly recommended for a chill outing in Saida!

topReviews.author: Zeinab Dirani
topReviews.text: Expensive in comparison to food quality and service. The concept is nice, and the atmosphere is best when it is a sunny weather. Otherwise, you wont get the bonus of seeing the sea due to the curtains.

name: Persian Cup Beirut. Authentic Persian Cuisine in Beirut
description: Persian Cup Beirut offers a unique dining experience with a focus on authentic Persian cuisine that transports you straight to the heart of Iran. The restaurant's carefully curated menu features traditional dishes made with fresh ingredients, ensuring every meal is bursting with flavor. The warm hospitality and inviting atmosphere make it a perfect spot for family gatherings or a romantic dinner, and the stunning decor adds to the overall experience.
localTip: Don't miss their saffron rice, which is a signature dish that pairs well with any main course.
scamWarning: Be wary of offers for 'free' drinks from strangers outside the restaurant, as they may lead to unexpected charges.

topReviews.author: Layla Farah
topReviews.text: I asked my Iranian friend about this place and they said it was authentic and delicious, so I checked it out for dinner and they were right! We ordered the kashlik lamb ribs, mast khiyar, and ghorme sabsi with saffron rice and it was divine! Portions were decent so we just shared this all between two. Beautiful Persian decor too!

topReviews.author: Tahsine Reda
topReviews.text:
I had lunch at Iranian Cup and it turned out to be a good experience. The restaurant is cozy, tucked away around a quiet corner in a cool neighborhood one of those places you wouldn‚Äôt expect, yet it delivers a truly authentic dining experience.

From the moment I arrived, I was greeted warmly. The staff is well-trained, attentive, and plentiful for the size of the restaurant, which means service runs smoothly. The atmosphere is vibrant but comfortable, with great attention to cleanliness and detail.

I ordered a mixed plate with chicken, kebab, and rice, and it was outstanding flavorful, fresh, and clearly made with care. The ayran (yogurt drink) was also delicious. Prices are fair for the quality, about $30 for one person, which I found reasonable compared to international dining standards.

A small observation: they ask every guest if they have a reservation, which is good for organization, but I think they could be a little more flexible in accommodating walk-ins. Luckily, I had no issue, but I could see how this might create some frustration at busy times.

Overall, this is a restaurant I would happily return to and even bring friends to impress. Limited menu, but very well chosen, excellent service, and great food. Definitely worth a visit.

topReviews.author: Antoun Boustani
topReviews.text: After hearing good reviews about this place, we stopped by to try it. The staff were welcoming. I liked how the place was decorated. The good was delicious. I loved the appetizers we had. The kebabs were so good. Sumac with the beef kabab was so delicious.  The rice was good tasting.  It was a good experience.  Keep up the good work.

name: Le Petit Gris
description: Le Petit Gris is a charming eatery that showcases the best of French-inspired Lebanese cuisine, offering a delightful fusion that is sure to please any palate. With its intimate setting and exceptional service, this restaurant provides a cozy atmosphere perfect for a romantic dinner or a special celebration. Each dish is thoughtfully prepared, combining local Lebanese ingredients with classic French techniques for a truly unique dining experience.
bestTimeToVisit: Weekdays for a quieter dining experience.
localTip: Pair your meal with a glass of Lebanese wine for the full experience.
scamWarning: Be cautious of street performers who may distract you while dining, as they can lead to unwanted attention.

topReviews.author: Peter Azzam
topReviews.text:
Petit Gris ‚Äì A Cozy Culinary Hideaway
We had dinner at Petit Gris and absolutely loved the experience. It‚Äôs a warm, intimate spot ‚Äî perfect for couples or small groups looking for a relaxed yet refined evening. The atmosphere is charming and understated, with soft lighting and thoughtful details that make the space feel special without being overdone.

The menu offers a delicious variety of dishes, beautifully presented and full of flavor. Everything we tried was carefully prepared, and the balance between creativity and comfort food was just right. The staff was welcoming and attentive, adding to the overall inviting feel of the place.

If you're in the mood for a quiet, cozy dinner in a place that feels both personal and elevated, Petit Gris is a wonderful choice.

topReviews.author: Nadine
topReviews.text:
I had a wonderful meal here with my friend. The restaurant is so charming with music playing in the background at a level where you can hear it but still talk.
The staff are so friendly and accommodating and the ambiance was charming.
I had the filet which was cooked beautifully and my friend had a burger which she loved.

The sorbet was outstanding.
Will definitely come again the next time I'm in Lebanon.

topReviews.author: Rana Andari

name: East Village Badaro - Open Kitchen

The lively atmosphere is accentuated by the open-concept layout, allowing diners to watch the chefs at work while enjoying their meals. This hidden gem is perfect for those looking to indulge in a variety of flavors and share experiences with friends and family in a casual setting.

topReviews.author: Greendelulu
topReviews.text:
I‚Äôve been to this restaurant before for brunch (which was ok), but the Monday steak frites formula for two? Absolutely amazing!
The meat was super tender, fries perfectly crispy and salty, and the entrec√¥te sauce honestly the best I‚Äôve had in Lebanon.
Even the dessert was delicious.
Safe to say I‚Äôll be coming back for dinner again!

topReviews.author: Leya Abou mrad
topReviews.text:
The team was excellent and the food was truly outstanding. I tried the salmon and it was honestly one of the best I‚Äôve ever had. There was a slight delay with the service since the place was crowded, but the manager handled everything so professionally and made it up to us with a dessert and it turned out to be one of the best desserts we‚Äôve ever had!

Thank you, Hamza, for the great experience.
Badaro branch üôå‚ú®

topReviews.author: Dikran N.
topReviews.text:
While the food was good, the waiters attentive, the kitchen delivery was extremely messy.

We ordered appetizers, including a soup, and main courses. Some appetizers arrived, then one main course, then the soup, then the rest of the main courses.

We were the first ones to order as the place was empty when we arrived, so we can't say the kitchen was overwhelmed. Management was nice enough to offer us free dessert, but the overall experience was one I would not repeat.

name: Tawlet
description: Tawlet is a delightful culinary experience that embodies the warmth of Lebanese hospitality through its homemade dishes and inviting atmosphere. Each day, a different Lebanese chef prepares a unique menu, showcasing the diverse regional flavors of Lebanon. This hidden gem not only serves delicious food but also offers a glimpse into the heart of Lebanese culture, making it a must-visit for any food lover.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit during lunch hours on weekdays for a more local experience, and try to make a reservation on weekends as it gets busy.
localTip: Don't hesitate to ask the staff for recommendations; they are passionate about their dishes and can guide you to the best options.
scamWarning: Be cautious of overly aggressive vendors outside who may try to lure you in with false promises of discounts; always check the menu prices before ordering.

topReviews.author: Jennifer Rhima
topReviews.text: Tawlet is a delicious spot for both their unique buffet and √† la carte menu. The atmosphere is so home-warming, it feels like you‚Äôre at your teta‚Äôs house. If you go for breakfast, I can‚Äôt recommend the eggs with awarma enough, absolutely delicious. They also sell all kinds of Lebanese kitchen items. Shout-out to Janine, who I met when visiting in the summer, she was lovely!

topReviews.author: Mazen Eid
topReviews.text: Lovely experience at Tawlet, always encourage anyone to visit and get home stuff with you. We went on a Sunday for lunch and the food was so good really felt like home.‚ô•Ô∏è

topReviews.author: Mark Whatmore
topReviews.text: Delicious Lebanese food and fantastic service

name: Super Vega
description: Super Vega is a cozy spot that has become a favorite among locals for its authentic Lebanese dishes and vibrant atmosphere. The restaurant is known for its generous portions and flavorful meals that capture the essence of Lebanon's rich culinary heritage. topReviews.author: Bargo Yousif

topReviews.author: Sam Reda

This place offers a service I have been missing in Lebanon.
Amazing
No need to chase waiters for attention, they're there 4 U right when U need them, without any fluffy words of niceties... Always right on point, pleasantly.
At one time they brought something to the table just when we thought of it ü§ú

name: Bayt Em Nazih
description: Nestled in a charming neighborhood, Bayt Em Nazih offers an authentic dining experience that feels like home. With its home-cooked meals and traditional Lebanese recipes passed down through generations, this restaurant provides a taste of true Lebanese hospitality. topReviews.author: JS

Very authentic and delicious Lebanese food in the heart of Hamra.
This was the best hummus that we've ever had in Lebanon and even in the world.
We would wholeheartedly dine here again if we ever visit Lebanon.

topReviews.author: armaghan butt

topReviews.author: Shayan El Hajj
topReviews.text:
Food is an 8/10

The chicken was a bit dry, however pasta is big portion.

topReviews.author: Lamis El Ghor
topReviews.text: A very nice Italian restaurant though we had higher expectations for sure. Food is nice but service would have almost ruined it with some weird statements and behaviour which you wouldn't expect from such a well established restaurant. Not sure would go back but a definite try in the neighbourhood

topReviews.author: heinz giering

name: BUCO
description: Nestled in the heart of Lebanon, BUCO is a culinary treasure that offers a unique blend of traditional and modern Lebanese cuisine. With its inviting atmosphere and friendly staff, this restaurant serves up delicious dishes that showcase the rich flavors of the region. Whether you're craving a hearty meal or a light snack, BUCO has something to satisfy every palate, making it a perfect spot for both locals and travelers alike.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit during the cooler months from October to April for a more pleasant dining experience.
localTip: Don't miss their signature mezze platter, which offers a perfect introduction to Lebanese flavors.
scamWarning: Be cautious of overly aggressive street vendors nearby who may try to sell you goods at inflated prices.

topReviews.author: Hassan D
topReviews.text:
Honestly, it‚Äôs one of the best burgers I‚Äôve had in Beirut. The staff are extremely friendly, and reservations are highly recommended as the place is usually crowded.
I ordered the shrimp tacos (7/10), fried chicken (9/10), miso BBQ burger (9/10), and the classic burger (9/10). I highly recommend choosing the 200g patty for a richer and better overall taste.
Overall, I strongly recommend this place to everyone looking for a great burger experience in Beirut.

topReviews.author: Makram Radwan
topReviews.text:
By far, the most unique food concept in Beirut and an extensive dining experience. Despite offering the best burger you‚Äôll find in town, the menu is crafted with mouthwatering items that you should not miss. Great ambiance, lovely vibes and top service.
Highly recommended: WAGUY Burger 200g, medium, lobster rolls, grilled beef with truffle & caramel sauce.

topReviews.author: Nizar ABOULTAIF -MARYA2444-
topReviews.text: An amazing spot for burgers and cocktails! The burgers were juicy, perfectly cooked, and packed with flavor, with great attention to quality and presentation. The cocktails were creative, well-balanced, and expertly made‚Äîevery sip was a treat. The vibe is fun and stylish, and the staff were friendly and attentive throughout. Definitely one of the best places in town for great food and drinks. Highly recommended! üçîüç∏

name: Shatila Lebanese Grill & Hookah Lounge
description: Shatila Lebanese Grill & Hookah Lounge is a hidden gem that captures the essence of Lebanese hospitality. This cozy spot combines delicious grilled meats and vegetarian options with an inviting hookah lounge, making it a great place to unwind and enjoy a meal with friends. The warm ambiance and attentive service will make your dining experience memorable, whether you're there for breakfast or a late-night feast.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings are particularly enjoyable as you can relax with a hookah under the stars.
localTip: Try their grilled kebabs, which are marinated to perfection and served with fresh pita bread.
scamWarning: Be wary of strangers offering unsolicited advice on where to eat; always trust your instincts about restaurant choices.

topReviews.author: Alisha Karim
topReviews.text: Shoutout to Mike for the amazing service he gave, and Fatima the Chef who has magic hands the food was so delicious!! The lamb kabab was perfectly charred with the rice smoky! I would recommend it 100%

topReviews.author: Joe H
topReviews.text: My party of 4 split a combo for 3 and still had leftovers for us all. Delicious baba ganoush, saffron rice, kebab. Can't wait to find an excuse to drop in again.

topReviews.author: Anum Nazar
topReviews.text: We got Shatila catered for our son‚Äôs 6 birthday. Food was delicious and very presentable. Set up, delivery, serving etc. were above our expectations. We are glad that we catered through them.

name: Mount Hermon
description: Mount Hermon is not just a stunning natural feature but also home to eateries that provide breathtaking views alongside delicious Lebanese fare. As you enjoy your meal, you‚Äôll be surrounded by the majestic beauty of the mountains, making every bite a sensory delight. This location is perfect for those looking to connect with nature while indulging in the rich culinary traditions of Lebanon.
bestTimeToVisit: The best time to visit is during spring and early summer when the weather is mild and the views are clear.
localTip: Don't forget to bring a camera; the scenery is too beautiful to miss capturing.
scamWarning: Ensure you visit established eateries to avoid overpriced tourist traps near the mountain.

topReviews.author: Jose Thomas
topReviews.text: Highest mountain of Israel. It is accessible by cable car. It was supposed to be snow peak until end of April every year, but this year, due to a heat wave it is fully melt by end of March itself and a few snow patches alone is seen.

topReviews.author: M·∫≠u D∆∞∆°ng Nguy·ªÖn
topReviews.text: It is a famous place and should be visited when visiting Israel. With the -4 degree cold, the feeling of climbing to the top of the mountain is truly yomost.

topReviews.author: Louie Farhat
topReviews.text:
It's really a wonderful advanture to do, mountain fully covered with snow.
Amazing place for everyone, a lot of activities for kids, i recommend this place very much to get out from ur mood and enjoy ur time here.

name: Jalset Al Erzal
description: Jalset Al Erzal is the perfect escape for those seeking authentic Lebanese cuisine in a serene setting. This charming restaurant offers a rustic atmosphere with a menu that highlights traditional dishes made from locally sourced ingredients. It‚Äôs an ideal spot for families and friends to gather, indulge in hearty meals, and create lasting memories over shared plates.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit in the late afternoon to enjoy the sunset while dining.
localTip: Opt for the daily specials, which often feature the freshest seasonal ingredients.
scamWarning: Be cautious of anyone promising free meals or asking for upfront payments; always settle your bill after dining.

topReviews.author: Ghina Sidani
topReviews.text: I‚Äôve been coming here for a while and I love how this restaurant has managed to keep its quality over the years. It‚Äôs a very relaxing and authentic Lebanese spot with a warm, welcoming vibe. Some people mention the limited items on the menu, but that‚Äôs actually what makes 3irzel special it‚Äôs known for its unique menu. Both indoor and outdoor seating areas are very nice. The service is amazing too; even though the place often gets very busy (which is totally normal), they still manage to keep everything running smoothly.

topReviews.author: Dan Yerganian
topReviews.text: Good place to have some food, beautiful atmosphere, most of the food items are delicious. Cleanliness could be better. But we always have a good time.

topReviews.author: Leya Badereldine
topReviews.text:
This was, without exaggeration, one of the most disturbing restaurant experiences I have ever had.

I entered the restaurant only to ask a simple question: whether we could sit outside, knowing that pets are not allowed indoors. My daughter was holding our cat securely inside a closed cage. Before we even spoke a single word, an employee began shouting aggressively at my daughter, repeatedly yelling ‚Äúget out, get out,‚Äù while pointing his finger at her.

What makes this even more unacceptable is that last year, I personally saw a customer at this same restaurant with a dog on a leash. Yet today, my daughter was treated with hostility and humiliation for holding a cat that was fully enclosed in a cage.

There was no explanation, no politeness, no attempt at respectful communication, only shouting. This behavior was deeply inappropriate and especially alarming because it was directed at a child.

When we asked to speak to the manager to calmly explain what had just happened, the same employee continued to shout from across the restaurant, saying:
‚ÄúŸäŸÑÿß ÿÆŸÑÿßÿµ ÿÆŸÑÿßÿµ ÿßŸÑŸÑŸá ŸÖÿπŸÉŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÑŸá ŸÖÿπŸÉŸÜ‚Äù,
even while we were already speaking with the manager.

Restaurants have the right to enforce rules, but they do not have the right to verbally intimidate, shame, or aggressively dismiss customers, particularly children. This incident reflects a serious lack of professionalism, hospitality, and staff training.

I left feeling shocked and disrespected. I will never return, and I strongly advise families to think twice before visiting this establishment.

name: Malak Al Tawouk
description: Malak Al Tawouk is a beloved fast-food restaurant that serves up some of the best shawarma and grilled chicken in Lebanon. Popular with both locals and tourists, this eatery is known for its quick service and flavorful dishes that bring a taste of Lebanese street food to your plate. Perfect for a casual meal, it's a must-visit for anyone craving authentic flavors in a relaxed environment.
bestTimeToVisit: Lunch hours are ideal for a quick yet satisfying meal after exploring the city.
localTip: Don‚Äôt skip the garlic sauce; it‚Äôs the perfect complement to your meal.
scamWarning: Always double-check your order before paying, as some places may charge for items you didn‚Äôt receive.

topReviews.author: Anthony
topReviews.text: Horrible, you order one small box of fries, they ignore you, minimum one hour for them to serve you a box if fries. Horrible service.

topReviews.author: Melted Butter
topReviews.text: Had taouk sandwich , regular size . It was tasty and fullfilling took it on brown bread . the garlic paste inside it is flavorful . a good cheat meal option for dinner. My friend had the larger size of the taouk sandwich , with brown bread , chicken and fries. U can customize ur own to make it more light and guilt free in a way

topReviews.author: Johnny Fakhry
topReviews.text: We asked for extra salad and the staff was so generous that we got the best and largest tawouk sandwiches ever in all Malak al Tawouk branches!

address: near the bus stop stationÿå Daoura, Lebanon

name: Swiss Butter
description: Nestled in the heart of Lebanon, Swiss Butter is a culinary delight that specializes in mouthwatering steaks and a variety of exquisite dishes. With its cozy ambiance and attentive service, this hidden gem offers a unique dining experience that combines comfort with gourmet flair. Perfect for both casual gatherings and special occasions, the restaurant's charm is complemented by its delectable menu, making it a worthwhile stop for food enthusiasts looking to indulge in something special.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings from Thursday to Saturday, when the atmosphere is lively and vibrant.
localTip: Try their signature steak, which is a crowd favorite and pairs beautifully with their selection of wines.
scamWarning: Always check the bill for any unexpected charges, as some places may try to add extras without informing you.

topReviews.author: Chronos
topReviews.text: Went with my friends and were sooo hungry that we aet the steak frites and forgot to take pictures üòÇ. Honestly the sauce is so so so good, like I cant emphasize enough on how tasty it is. I don't know what they do to it but it's definitely worth the trip just for their sauce. Their desserts are also very good especially the pain perdu ( I got pictures of those at least üòÇ) Definitely worth trying out for sure!

topReviews.author: Sarah Hdeib
topReviews.text:
One of my all time favorite restaurants/staff.
The service at this place is impeccable which makes the whole dining experience 1000 times better.
They are VERY attentive which I appreciate.
Special shout-out to Adam & Ali Karaki, thank you.
If I could write more than one review I would

topReviews.author: Sena Khateeb
topReviews.text: I tried Swiss Butter a few years ago and decided to visit again this year. The sauce has a slightly sour taste that I don‚Äôt recall from before, but it‚Äôs still delicious. We had half-chicken half-beef. Yum!

name: Merchak Beirut
description: Merchak Beirut offers a delightful journey into Lebanese cuisine, where each dish is crafted with love and authenticity. This hidden gem is celebrated for its fresh ingredients and traditional recipes, providing diners with an immersive taste of local flavors. The warm, inviting atmosphere makes it an ideal spot for families and friends to gather, while the attentive staff ensures a memorable dining experience that resonates with the rich culinary heritage of Lebanon.
bestTimeToVisit: Lunch hours on weekends, when the restaurant is less crowded and you can enjoy a leisurely meal.
localTip: Don't miss their mezze platter, a perfect way to sample a variety of traditional dishes.
scamWarning: Be cautious of overly enthusiastic recommendations for dishes that are not on the menu; they may come at a premium price.

topReviews.author: Nour Hawy
topReviews.text: I was disappointed by the level of professionalism from the staff. This was my second time giving this place a chance, and unfortunately the experience was just as disappointing... The way situations were handled did not feel respectful or organized. Customer service is a big part of the dining experience, and this is something that really needs to be worked on.

topReviews.author: Lamis El Ghor
topReviews.text: A good hyped address for people who like arguileh. Since I absolutely can't bear it, it was not a very pleasant experience (no non-smoking space). Food is tasty but prices above average for Lebanese food. Can find equivalent at lower price. Decor is nice. Service is OK. Bathrooms are not practical since they are 2 floors underground which is inconvenient for senior people or limited mobility.

topReviews.author: Mike Aoun
topReviews.text: Overall experience was average. Our seating took some time and changing although we had reservations, the food was average. The staff were generally nice. The concept and furniture are pretty, the clientele is superficial. Great for people who like shisha, not my cup of tea.

name: Vicoli Saifi
description: Vicoli Saifi is an Italian restaurant in Lebanon that transports you straight to the heart of Italy with its rustic decor and authentic menu. Known for its homemade pasta and wood-fired pizzas, this charming eatery is a favorite among locals and visitors alike. The inviting atmosphere and friendly staff make each visit feel special, while the rich flavors and quality ingredients ensure that every meal is a delight. Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner or a family gathering, Vicoli Saifi delivers an unforgettable dining experience.
bestTimeToVisit: Dinner time, especially on weekends when they often have live music to enhance the ambiance.
localTip: Reserve a table in advance, as this popular spot tends to fill up quickly, especially on Friday nights.
scamWarning: Avoid accepting unsolicited menu recommendations from street vendors nearby, as they may lead you to overpriced tourist traps.

topReviews.author: Nada Jreissati
topReviews.text:
A Hidden Gem in the Heart of Saifi

Vicoli Saifi continues to deliver a consistently elevated dining experience. The ambiance strikes the right balance between upscale and welcoming ‚Äî perfect for a long lunch or an intimate dinner.

The food is the real highlight: fresh ingredients, rich flavors, and beautifully plated dishes. Whether you‚Äôre going for their signature pasta or a lighter seafood dish, you can expect thoughtful preparation and generous portions.

Service is attentive without being overbearing, and the staff knows the menu well. A great spot if you‚Äôre looking for quality in both food and atmosphere ‚Äî one of the rare places where both meet effortlessly.

Definitely a go-to in the area.

topReviews.author: Mr H
topReviews.text: Went to this restaurant based on reading some experienced reviewers notes, and it was spot on accurate. Food is very tasty service is excellent, location is great, and you can get very good value for money, we were 6 and had a full 3 course menu with plenty of wine and soft drinks for 56$ per person. 5 stars for me

topReviews.author: Ygs Your guide
topReviews.text: The food was amazing and the service was even better, some of the best waiters in town. Pizza dough was perfect and the truffle sauce was delicious

name: Mahfouz Stores
description: Mahfouz Stores is a unique establishment that beautifully blends a clothing store with a dining experience, offering a taste of local culture in a vibrant setting. Visitors can explore an array of stylish outfits while enjoying delicious Lebanese delicacies, making it a perfect spot for those who love to shop and dine simultaneously. The eclectic atmosphere, filled with local art and decor, adds a special touch to your visit, encouraging you to linger and soak in the creativity that surrounds you.
bestTimeToVisit: Afternoons during the week when the atmosphere is relaxed and perfect for leisurely browsing.
localTip: Take your time to explore both the clothing and food offerings; you might find unique pieces and tasty treats.
scamWarning: Be cautious of any overly aggressive sales pitches; take your time to make your selections.

topReviews.author: sawsan jabbour
topReviews.text: Relatively cheap prices. You can find sports wear, pyjamas, kitchen tools, and men's wear.

topReviews.author: Jarir Zughbi
topReviews.text: Good prices but limited choices

topReviews.author: jay bay
topReviews.text: Amazing prices with amazing clothes and pretty good fabric

name: T-Marbouta
description: T-Marbouta is a charming Lebanese restaurant that offers a delightful mix of traditional and modern dishes, all served in a cozy and welcoming environment. The restaurant is known for its generous portions and vibrant flavors, making it a favorite among those seeking an authentic taste of Lebanon. With a menu that showcases the best of local ingredients, T-Marbouta invites guests to indulge in a culinary adventure that reflects the rich cultural tapestry of the region, creating memorable dining experiences that linger long after the meal.
bestTimeToVisit: Weekdays at lunchtime, when you can enjoy a quieter atmosphere and attentive service.
localTip: Be sure to try their grilled dishes, which are prepared to perfection and celebrated by regulars.
scamWarning: Double-check the menu prices before ordering, as some items might have special pricing that isn't immediately clear.

topReviews.author: JS
topReviews.text:
Very authentic and delicious Lebanese food in the heart of Hamra.
This was the best hummus that we've ever had in Lebanon and even in the world.
We would wholeheartedly dine here again if we ever visit Lebanon.

topReviews.author: armaghan butt
topReviews.text: Liked by locals. Tucked away in a corner not easily visible from street. Has an open space and a small hall. Food was nice. Service was very good. Worth trying.

topReviews.author: Yahya Nawar
topReviews.text:
The atmosphere, the vibes, services and the taste.

I liked the atmosphere the volume level of music and how quiet and calm the place was.

The taste of food especially Mezza was really taken care of (made with love)

The staff were welcoming and helpful with the menu

Local Arak was good experience

It was a good Thursday night

address: HAMRA SQUARE, GROUND FLOORÿå Bayrut, Lebanon

name: Universal Snack
description: Tucked away in a vibrant neighborhood, Universal Snack is a culinary treasure that delights both locals and visitors alike. Known for its unique twist on traditional Lebanese fare, the restaurant offers a cozy atmosphere and an inviting menu that showcases the flavors of the region. Whether you're craving a quick bite or a leisurely meal, this spot promises to satisfy your taste buds with its fresh ingredients and authentic recipes.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings, especially during the weekends, when the atmosphere is lively and the place is bustling with locals enjoying their meals.
localTip: Don‚Äôt miss their signature dishes, especially the shawarma and falafel, which are said to be among the best in town.
scamWarning: Be cautious of street vendors nearby who may try to sell you overpriced snacks; stick to the restaurant for the best experience.

topReviews.author: Sima Jabri
topReviews.text: Really loved this place, best chicken escalope I‚Äôve ever tried! Homemade food and cozy diner vibes :) affordable prices and huge portions

topReviews.author: Zeina El Zein
topReviews.text:
If you are looking for homemade food this is the place to try. Iconic place!

Escalope and burgers are tasty, delicious and a must try!

Service is great and the staff are super friendly.

topReviews.author: josee bilezikjian
topReviews.text:
I visited this place yesterday, I was happy by the quality/price! They taking all the precautions for covid-19!
Tbh, its the first restaurant I visit that haven‚Äôt changed the quality of his food
A very old snack. Delicious food. Friendly staff. They should open in another place like dbayeh jounieh. Very affordable prices for what is served. They still have the same taste of food for the past 5-7 years!
This place is highly recommended!
All the love for their friendly staff and owner!

name: Le Relais de l'Entrec√¥te
description: Le Relais de l'Entrec√¥te is a charming eatery that brings a slice of Paris to Lebanon, specializing in classic French cuisine with a focus on steak and frites. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot for a romantic dinner or a special celebration. With its attentive service and rich flavors, this hidden gem offers a delightful culinary experience that transports you straight to the streets of France.
bestTimeToVisit: Weekdays for a quieter experience, allowing you to fully enjoy the meal without the weekend rush.
localTip: Try their secret sauce that comes with the steak; it‚Äôs a well-guarded recipe that keeps patrons coming back.
scamWarning: Avoid dining at places that offer overly aggressive promotions or discounts; stick to well-reviewed establishments like Le Relais.

topReviews.author: Jennifer Rhima
topReviews.text: If there‚Äôs one place my husband and I come to every time we‚Äôre visiting Lebanon, it‚Äôs here. Entrec√¥te is always pleasantly consistent. It‚Äôs such a simple yet exquisite meal. You choose how you want your steak cooked, and it comes with a delicious salad, steak frites, and we usually get a half bottle of wine. The experience is cozy, and the staff are professional. Whether it‚Äôs a winter day or the middle of summer, you can never go wrong. They don‚Äôt take reservations, but we‚Äôve never had to wait. Can‚Äôt recommend it enough!

topReviews.author: Juliano Sleiman
topReviews.text:
If you love steak and fries, this place is heaven!

The set menu is pretty simple but perfect‚Äîfresh salad, tender steak with their famous sauce, and crispy fries that keep coming. Total set menu is about 30$/person, excluding dessert and drinks.

The Parisian bistro vibe and friendly service make the whole experience even better.

Managers and waiters are very polite, friendly, and respectful.

Not to mention the delicious dessert - Yummm!!

topReviews.author: Eduardo
topReviews.text: Charmy, cozy and elegant place to lunch or dinner in Beirut. We went craving for high quality meat and reached our expectations.

name: Tavolina
description: If you're in the mood for Italian cuisine, Tavolina is a hidden gem that promises to deliver authentic flavors right in the heart of Lebanon. Known for its artisanal pizzas and handmade pasta, the restaurant boasts a cozy yet elegant atmosphere perfect for both casual dining and special occasions. Each dish is crafted with care, ensuring that every bite takes you on a culinary journey to Italy.
bestTimeToVisit: Lunch hours when the restaurant is less crowded, allowing for a more pleasant dining experience.
localTip: Make sure to ask about their daily specials, which often feature seasonal ingredients and unique dishes not on the regular menu.
scamWarning: Be wary of taxi drivers who may recommend other restaurants for a commission; Tavolina is a reputable choice that locals love.

topReviews.author: Pedro Javier Mart√≠nez
topReviews.text: Tavolina stands out for flavor and consistency in Beirut. The special house sauce is rich and well balanced. It lifts every dish without overpowering it. Seafood tastes fresh and clean, cooked with precision. Meat is the highlight. Tender, juicy, and full of flavor. Each cut arrives perfectly cooked. Service stays calm and attentive. The setting feels comfortable and refined. A strong choice for Italian cuisine in the city at Tavolina.

topReviews.author: Lamis El Ghor
topReviews.text: This is a restaurant that resisted well and even expanded, so thumbs up anyway! The experience all in all is great with the good service,  varied menu, non-smoking indoor seating and a pleasant outdoor section. Salads were great, pasta delicious and pizza quite good. Desserts can be better tasting but could pass anyway to focus on the main platters. Definitely going back

topReviews.author: Malak Bou diab
topReviews.text: The place is so cozzy i liked it it was my first time and the food was good

name: COUQLEY
description: COUQLEY offers a delightful fusion of French and Lebanese cuisine, set in a cozy bistro-style setting that invites you to relax and enjoy. From delectable pastries to gourmet dishes, every meal is a celebration of flavors that will leave you craving for more. The friendly staff and charming decor create an inviting atmosphere perfect for catching up with friends or enjoying a quiet evening out.
bestTimeToVisit: Dinner time, when the ambiance is enhanced by soft lighting and lively chatter, making it ideal for a dining experience.
localTip: Don‚Äôt miss their dessert menu; the chocolate fondant is a must-try for any sweet tooth!
scamWarning: Be cautious of offers from unofficial tour guides promising discounts at various eateries; stick to well-known places like COUQLEY.

topReviews.author: Reem Wahoud
topReviews.text: Couqley is a lovely French bistro with a great location and wonderful vibes. The food is really good, and they offer a nice selection of wines. The service is excellent and the welcome is warm. It‚Äôs a very cozy restaurant, especially in winter and the food is simply delicious.

topReviews.author: Charbel kajouni
topReviews.text:
We arrived at Cookley around 9:30. The hostess approached us and politely asked us to wait until our table was cleaned.

After we were seated, we tried calling two waiters, but they ignored us and acted as if they didn‚Äôt see us. Eventually, a waiter came and took our order: chicken, beef, and duck (three dishes).

The beef and duck arrived, and we ate and finished them. When the chicken still hadn‚Äôt arrived, we called another waiter to ask about it. I clearly told him that if the chicken had not been ordered, to cancel it. He insisted that it was on the way and would take four more minutes‚Äîdespite the fact that we had ordered it over 30 minutes earlier, and took 10 additional minutes. it was obvious it hadn‚Äôt been placed.

Overall, the food was good, but the service was below average, especially considering the large number of staff on the floor. I would recommend the Dbayeh branch instead for better service.

The ironic part was when I asked for the check, and a waiter made a joke about how ‚Äúthe fastest thing we have is the bill.‚Äù I paid and left.

I expected much better service from a place like this.

topReviews.author: Ziad Selfani
topReviews.text: Nice French bistro tucked in a small alley friendly staff delicious meals cooked to perfection. A must try for meat and French cuisine lovers.

name: Couqley French Bistro _ Dbayeh
description: Nestled in Dbayeh, Couqley French Bistro is a delightful spot that embodies the essence of French dining while embracing the warmth of Lebanese hospitality. With a menu filled with classic French dishes and a selection of fine wines, this bistro provides a charming backdrop for any occasion. The inviting ambiance, coupled with attentive service, makes it a favorite among locals seeking a taste of France without leaving Lebanon.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings during weekdays, when it is less crowded, allowing for a more intimate dining experience.
localTip: Pair your meal with one of their carefully selected wines for a truly delightful experience.
scamWarning: Be aware of overly enthusiastic promoters outside the restaurant; trust your instincts and head directly to Couqley for a genuine dining experience.

topReviews.author: Marie S.
topReviews.text:
Couqley Bistro Parisian is one of the best dining experiences I have had in Beirut. From start to finish, everything was flawless. The staff went above and beyond with professionalism, warmth, and attention to detail that made us feel genuinely cared for.

A special thank you to Luigi, who is also the assistant manager and served us during our visit. He gave us the best experience with outstanding customer service, genuine hospitality, and an impressive knowledge of the menu. His energy truly elevated our evening and made the entire dining experience unforgettable.

We ordered the steak and frites, chicken and frites, French onion soup, and pain perdu for dessert. Every single dish was exceptional. The steak was perfectly cooked and tender, the frites were golden and crisp, and the French onion soup was rich and comforting. The pain perdu was the perfect sweet ending to a beautiful meal.

The atmosphere is elegant yet cozy, with a Parisian charm that makes you forget you are in the heart of Beirut. Whether you are celebrating something special or simply craving authentic French cuisine with top-tier service, Couqley Bistro Parisian is a must-visit.

Bravo to Luigi and the entire team. You have truly earned every one of these five stars!

topReviews.author: Elie Serge Tannous
topReviews.text: Had an amazing experience at Couqley in Dbayeh! The steak frites was cooked to perfection, and the pain perdu was heavenly. Service was top-notch, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting. Highly recommend for a great night out!

topReviews.author: Rouba A
topReviews.text: I just love this place. Couqley has such a warm ambience and is always a great spot to enjoy good food with friends. The dishes are consistently delicious and the atmosphere works perfectly for group gatherings or a relaxed meal out. Always a reliable favorite.

name: Cocteau Restaurant
description: Nestled in the heart of Lebanon, Cocteau Restaurant offers a unique dining experience that combines exquisite flavors with a cozy atmosphere. Here, you'll find a delightful menu featuring both local and international dishes, all crafted with fresh ingredients to ensure a memorable meal. The warm ambiance and attentive staff make it a perfect spot for both casual meals and special occasions.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings during the spring and fall for the best weather.
localTip: Try their signature mezze platter for a taste of traditional Lebanese cuisine.
scamWarning: Be cautious of unsolicited recommendations from locals; always check reviews before trying new places.

topReviews.author: celina obeid
topReviews.text: Amazing as usual. The mango tart is a MUST. I would only suggest they don‚Äôt make the main dishes ahead of time because our duck was cold and a bit dry.

topReviews.author: Jc Hatem
topReviews.text: We celebrated our one-year anniversary here and it was perfect. The cake I ordered was presented beautifully, the manager was welcoming and attentive, and the food was outstanding. The atmosphere made the night unforgettable an amazing experience all around!

topReviews.author: Hassan Zebib
topReviews.text:
The Vibe: It is "fancy" without being stiff. The interior features rich woods, plush seating, and warm lighting that makes the room feel expensive but inviting.
‚Ä¢ The Crowd: You‚Äôll find a mix of the city‚Äôs elite, business power-lunchers, and couples celebrating milestones. It‚Äôs a place where people dress up, and the room feels "alive" with the hum of sophisticated conversation.

name: Tres Marias Charity Organization Office
description: Tres Marias offers more than just a meal; it‚Äôs a heartwarming experience that combines delicious food with a meaningful cause. This charming eatery serves incredible dishes while supporting local charity initiatives, making every bite you take contribute to a greater good. With a welcoming atmosphere and a menu that delights the palate, it‚Äôs an ideal spot for those looking to eat well and do good.
bestTimeToVisit: Lunch hours during weekdays for a quieter atmosphere.
localTip: Ask about their special charity events, where you can enjoy unique dishes.
scamWarning: Always verify the authenticity of charity claims to ensure your contributions are going to the right place.

name: Brio Coffee
description: Brio Coffee is a delightful haven for coffee lovers in Lebanon. Known for its expertly brewed coffees and artisanal pastries, this cozy caf√© invites you to unwind in its inviting atmosphere. Whether you're looking to catch up with friends or enjoy a quiet moment with a book, Brio Coffee serves as the perfect backdrop for both relaxation and inspiration.
bestTimeToVisit: Morning hours for the freshest pastries and a vibrant atmosphere.
localTip: Don't miss their seasonal coffee blends for a unique tasting experience.
scamWarning: Be wary of street vendors offering coffee at unusually low prices; stick to reputable cafes.

topReviews.author: Jay ‚ÄúAbulJouj‚Äù Ghazali
topReviews.text: Perfectly set up to provide a very comfortable, relaxing, and cozy atmosphere. The owner/manager and his staff crew were very friendly and accommodating. They also proved their deep knowledge and total understanding of the various types and flavors of coffee. Strongly recommended visity this unique and cute coffee shop!

topReviews.author: Alexandra Koptyaeva
topReviews.text: It's absolutely the best specialty coffee shop in Hamra. I ended up coming here every day, and the service was consistently good. The V60 coffee is amazing, with three or more bean origins to choose from. The place also offers healthy snacks, and the atmosphere is always calm and peaceful. I highly recommend this place to coffee lovers.

topReviews.author: K Phillips
topReviews.text: Visited this nice new cafe while traveling from New York to Beirut. Beautiful interiors, with natural elements. There is even a gym next door. The coffee was done very well and the beans are specialty. The owner is so friendly- will definitely be back!

name: Get Grilled
description: Get Grilled is a culinary gem that specializes in flavorful grilled dishes from around the world. With an emphasis on quality ingredients and bold flavors, this restaurant is a must-visit for anyone craving delicious grilled meals in a laid-back environment. Its diverse menu caters to a variety of tastes, ensuring there's something for everyone to enjoy.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings for a lively dining atmosphere.
localTip: Try their grilled kebabs, which are a local favorite!
scamWarning: Avoid unlicensed street food vendors that might not adhere to safety standards.

topReviews.author: Lara Akoum
topReviews.text:
I can honestly say Get Grilled is ABSOLUTELY the best Indian restaurant in Lebanon. Every bite was full of flavor. We ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and Butter Chicken both incredibly rich, perfectly spiced and cooked to perfection.
The potato samosas were crispy and delicious, and the mango lassi wow!!! Highly recommended!!

topReviews.author: Steve Creitz
topReviews.text: Absolutely the very best Thai Green Curry dish I have had since lining in Bangkok! The place is cute, and though it is behind the university and it seems there might be no parking, there were surprisingly plenty of spots. The Garlic Naan and Indian curry were superb. Don‚Äôt miss out on their Coconut Farti for dessert! The fact that is sheesha-free sealed the deal for us.

topReviews.author: Nadim Lattouf
topReviews.text:
Authentic Indian cuisine place serving traditional dishes made by Indian chef. Offers a genuine taste of India. Dishes are even served in Indian style stainless steel plates. We had a variety of dishes ranging from the famous Indian butter chicken, Biryani rice, shrimp coconut curry, to palak paneer. Naan bread and yogurt with cucumber on the side to accompany the food.
We paid close to $70 for 4 dishes and some butter Naan bread. The average price per meat dish averaged about $15 which bit on the high side considering that the restaurant is not high end.
Waiters are friendly, welcoming and helpful. All in all, a great experience full of Indian spices, cook and served the authentic way!

name: Bavaglino
description: Bavaglino is an Italian restaurant that transports you straight to Italy with its authentic flavors and cozy ambiance. Known for its homemade pasta and traditional recipes, this charming eatery is a favorite among locals and visitors alike. With a focus on quality ingredients and a passion for food, Bavaglino promises a delightful dining experience that will leave you craving more.
bestTimeToVisit: Dinner time for a romantic setting with dim lighting.
localTip: Pair your meal with a glass of their fine Italian wine for the full experience.
scamWarning: Be cautious of overly aggressive promoters outside; choose to enter based on personal research.

topReviews.author: dina antar
topReviews.text:
One of the best Italian restaurants in Beirut and the best food I‚Äôve tried in 2025 so far.
The truffle pizza is absolutely delicious and perfectly made.
The vibe is cozy and stylish with a beautiful Christmas atmosphere.
The staff are incredibly professional, friendly, and welcoming, they truly make you feel at home.
Highly recommended.

topReviews.author: Review Expert
topReviews.text:
Bavaglino is one of my favorite Italian places and it never disappoints. Everything tastes fresh and authentic, from the perfectly made dough to the rich sauces that feel homemade. The pepperoni pizza is a personal favorite, thin and crispy with just the right balance of flavors, and every other dish we tried was just as delicious. The cozy small kitchen adds to the charm because it feels like you are being served real homemade Italian food.

The service is always warm and efficient, with staff who make you feel welcome and well taken care of. Prices are very fair for the quality you get, which makes it easy to come back again and again. The atmosphere is another highlight. Sitting by the stairs near the restaurant gives off such a nice vibe, and the whole setting feels relaxed yet full of Italian character. It‚Äôs perfect for friends, family, or even a casual date night.

Overall, Bavaglino delivers on food, service, and atmosphere every single time. A spot I truly recommend for anyone craving authentic Italian flavors in a cozy setting.

topReviews.author: fadi ghorayeb
topReviews.text: Amazing Italian place in Beirut with incredibly delicious food and super friendly service. I loved the option of half portions, which is such a great idea and lets you try more dishes in one visit. The absolute standout was the honey truffle pizza sweet and rich all at once. Definitely coming back!

name: Saida Rest House Restaurant
description: Nestled along the coastline, Saida Rest House Restaurant offers a delightful dining experience with spectacular views of the Mediterranean. The menu celebrates traditional Lebanese cuisine, emphasizing fresh ingredients and authentic flavors that will transport your taste buds to the heart of Lebanon. This hidden gem is perfect for a family outing or a romantic dinner, making it a must-visit for food lovers.
bestTimeToVisit: Spring and early autumn when the weather is mild and pleasant.
localTip: Try their grilled fish, which is a favorite among locals and pairs beautifully with a glass of arak.
scamWarning: Be cautious of overly aggressive vendors around the area, especially near the beach; always verify prices before ordering.

topReviews.author: Ragi Gebeily
topReviews.text:
Omg what a great place
We had our breakfast and the food was supper awesome but nothing to be compared with the view
Right by the beach and next to the citadel

topReviews.author: naim joubran
topReviews.text:
An old house converted to a restaurant. They serve all kinds of food and non alcoholic drinks.
Their terrace overlooks the sea so it is a magnificent place to relax.
We just went there to have coffee. The coffee was not good.
The waiters were friendly and helpful.
Prices are relatively high.

topReviews.author: Jasmine Salem
topReviews.text: They didn‚Äôt tell us that they only take cash. No card machine which is ridiculous because this is a very touristy spot. We were told to go find an atm machine to withdraw cash and come back and pay. The place is very nice because it‚Äôs right at the beach but definitely not worth it overall. The food was very average. I don‚Äôt recommend.

name: Jabbour Restaurant
description: Tucked away in a cozy corner, Jabbour Restaurant is a culinary treasure that specializes in Middle Eastern delicacies. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it an ideal spot for both locals and visitors to indulge in hearty meals. The skilled chefs work tirelessly to deliver authentic flavors and generous portions, ensuring that every meal is memorable.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings during the week when it's less crowded and you can enjoy a relaxed dining experience.
localTip: Don't miss their famous kebabs, which are grilled to perfection and served with homemade garlic sauce.
scamWarning: Avoid street food vendors near the restaurant who may sell unverified products; always choose established eateries.

topReviews.author: Marwan Hawa
topReviews.text:
Jabbour has been around for nearly 35 years, and it‚Äôs easy to see why! Still going strong and best known for their delicious shawarma ‚Äî you simply can‚Äôt go wrong with it. A true classic that never disappoints.
No atmosphere really without music!

topReviews.author: Antoun Boustani
topReviews.text: O ordered a delivery from this place for lunch. I ordered 1 beef and 1 chicken shawarma. The order came on time. The packaging was on point. It reflected the place?s identity. The taste was good. I love their chicken shawarma. Keep up the good work.

topReviews.author: Maurice Salameh
topReviews.text: Shawarma is greasy but it‚Äôs good compared to other places.

name: Kadisha Valley
description: Kadisha Valley, known for its breathtaking natural beauty, is not just a scenic spot but also offers unique dining experiences amidst stunning landscapes. Here, you can enjoy a meal surrounded by lush greenery and majestic mountains, making it a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. name: Mayrig
description: Mayrig is a delightful dining destination that brings the flavors of Armenian-Lebanese cuisine to life. topReviews.author: Pedro Javier Mart√≠nez
topReviews.text: Mayrig offers refined Armenian cuisine in a calm and elegant setting. Flavors feel deep and authentic. Mezze arrive fresh and well balanced. topReviews.author: Bahaa Malaeb

name: Jai Asian Restaurant
description: Jai Asian Restaurant in Lebanon is a culinary treasure that transports you to the heart of Asia with its exquisite dishes. This charming restaurant specializes in Thai, Indian, and other Asian cuisines, ensuring a diverse menu that caters to every palate. From flavorful curries to aromatic rice dishes, each meal is expertly prepared using fresh ingredients that celebrate the rich culinary traditions of Asia. The warm atmosphere and attentive service make it a must-visit for food lovers seeking something unique.

scamWarning: Avoid unsolicited food delivery offers from unverified sources.

topReviews.author: Nadim Lattouf
topReviews.text:
Authentic Asian cuisine joint that will satisfy your craving for Indian and Thai street food.
We were well served at Jai with our friendly host explaining the menu items and helping with recommendations.
Everything  we had tasted nice & fresh. What we liked is that it wasn‚Äôt greasy and on the heavy side.
We had:
Prawn dumplings which I thought lacked a bit of prawns on the inside.
The coconut and lemongrass soup was the highlight of our meal. The best we had!
The spinach & peanuts salad was amazing.
The butter chicken light and tasty, but in my view could take a bit more chicken.
We also had coconut korma curry w/ shrimp which was very nice. We felt the shrimps were too small and too little.
We also had amazing Chapati bread. Make sure you order it ahead, it‚Äôs freshly made and will take abt 10min.
Overall a great experience. Prices are a bit on the high side considering you are sat on  the street and not in an indoor seating area.
It was nice gesture to get sweet fried dumplings on the house!

topReviews.author: Ghina Sidani
topReviews.text:
I had a fantastic experience at Jai Asian Restaurant in Beirut. The food was bursting with authentic Asian flavors every dish we tried was perfectly seasoned and thoughtfully prepared. The Pad Thai was a standout, rich, balanced, and deeply satisfying.

The ambiance is warm and inviting, with a cozy layout and a modern, open-kitchen concept that lets you watch the chefs in action a great touch that adds to the overall vibe. The staff were incredibly friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable, making us feel genuinely welcomed from start to finish.

Whether you're an Asian food enthusiast or just in the mood for something different, Jai is definitely worth a visit. I‚Äôm already looking forward to going back to explore more of their menu!

topReviews.author: Traicy najem
topReviews.text: I was craving asian food, we tried it for the first time. The lady was very welcoming, we ordered prawn dumplings, shrimps summer rolls, baw bun beef and Pad Thai mix (shrimps and chicken). Love it

name: On Board Games and Tales - Hamra
description: On Board Games and Tales in Hamra is not just a cafe, but a haven for board game enthusiasts and food lovers alike. Here, you can enjoy a delicious meal or a cup of coffee while immersing yourself in a variety of board games, making it an ideal spot for friends and families to gather. This inviting space fosters a sense of community and fun, making each visit an engaging experience, whether you're a casual player or a competitive gamer.
bestTimeToVisit: Afternoons on weekends for a lively gaming atmosphere.
localTip: Bring your friends for a group game night; they have a fantastic selection.
scamWarning: Be wary of anyone offering to sell you games on the street; they may not be legitimate.

topReviews.author: JAD BORGHOL
topReviews.text:
Today was the last time I would go there until some drastic changes are made to the staff and food.

Let's start with the positives. The space is nice. The elongated room makes for less noise echo and there are some good spots for a calmer environment. Nice looking and varied collection of minis, dice and trinkets available for purchase. Gaming crew is always helpful. They take the time to explain new games, give recommendations and are generally pleasant to chat with. Waiters are less friendly but still professional.

Food, however, is a total disaster. Took 2 bites from the pesto pasta salad today (add tuna, replace pesto with mayo) and tasted something off. Told the waiter, got back to me with a pleasant yet dismissive "the chef said there is nothing wrong with the mayo", which is service industry speak for: you're wrong. We ordered 2 of those, my friend eneded up replacing his with a regular pesto one, add tuna, and I declined a new one as to not risk it. When asked if the new one was ok, friend said yes. We got charged for 2 plates, which I didn't contest, but still not proper customer service. Also, the smell of the pepsi cans was off, and the cookie was piping hot on one side and ice cold on the other. Last time I was there, the salad was great, same changes we made but it was actually good. We did take loaded fries and those were bad, oil tasted funny and sauce was horrible. Inconsistent at best. Hiccups in food service in a gaming hub is understandable, but dismissing concerns about mayo or tuna of all things, is unprofessional.

But wait, there's more! [Edited part concerning one of the employees. It's unfair to put the onus on the place for the actions of one person, so I'm removing it].

I used to go there once or twice a week when it first opened. Got the yearly offer. Those days were great, everything was on point, but they are unfortunately long gone. Met the owner a couple of times, animated and friendly guy, especially in the early days, but haven't seen him in a while. I believe there's a strong correlation between his presence and the quality of the place. It's a shame.

Edit next day: spoke to management, very friendly and concerned about the betterment of the place. Looking forward for a meet-up and cheering for positive changes.

topReviews.author: Tarek Khadra
topReviews.text: A great place to enjoy playing board games with your friends especially that it is dedicated for that. On-board is very spacious with variety of sections and big tables. Smoking is forbidden indoor even icos and vape which is better. People there are nice and friendly. The games that can be played are endless and it is equipped for this purpose, the seating and lighting. They have a bar to serve drinks and food. Also, you can buy games, related items, gifts and accessories.

topReviews.author: dalia chedid
topReviews.text: Perfect place to hqve fun with family or friends,  ha e some delicious food and play social games

name: Bavaglino
description: Bavaglino is a charming Italian restaurant that brings a slice of Italy to Lebanon, combining traditional recipes with a warm and inviting atmosphere. Known for its homemade pasta and authentic pizzas, each dish is crafted with passion and the finest ingredients. The cozy decor makes it a perfect spot for a romantic dinner or a casual meal with friends. The staff's dedication to providing an exceptional dining experience ensures that every visit feels special, leaving you craving more.

scamWarning: Be cautious of unofficial parking attendants near the restaurant asking for tips.

topReviews.text:
One of the best Italian restaurants in Beirut and the best food I‚Äôve tried in 2025 so far.
The truffle pizza is absolutely delicious and perfectly made.
The vibe is cozy and stylish with a beautiful Christmas atmosphere.
The staff are incredibly professional, friendly, and welcoming, they truly make you feel at home.
Highly recommended.

topReviews.author: Review Expert
topReviews.text:
Bavaglino is one of my favorite Italian places and it never disappoints. Everything tastes fresh and authentic, from the perfectly made dough to the rich sauces that feel homemade. The pepperoni pizza is a personal favorite, thin and crispy with just the right balance of flavors, and every other dish we tried was just as delicious. The cozy small kitchen adds to the charm because it feels like you are being served real homemade Italian food.

The service is always warm and efficient, with staff who make you feel welcome and well taken care of. Prices are very fair for the quality you get, which makes it easy to come back again and again. The atmosphere is another highlight. Sitting by the stairs near the restaurant gives off such a nice vibe, and the whole setting feels relaxed yet full of Italian character. It‚Äôs perfect for friends, family, or even a casual date night.

Overall, Bavaglino delivers on food, service, and atmosphere every single time. A spot I truly recommend for anyone craving authentic Italian flavors in a cozy setting.

topReviews.author: fadi ghorayeb
topReviews.text: Amazing Italian place in Beirut with incredibly delicious food and super friendly service. I loved the option of half portions, which is such a great idea and lets you try more dishes in one visit. The absolute standout was the honey truffle pizza sweet and rich all at once. Definitely coming back!

It left me wondering‚Ä¶ why such a steep price? Great experience overall, but definitely on the pricey side.

topReviews.author: Ahmad
topReviews.text:
The resturant is beautiful and I think the brand name that was built over the years is the reason you always find it full!

The service is below average, initially we did not order many plates and the waiter made it clear to show his attitude, later on when we order more, thats where he became friendly, sure not going out to feel pressured!

The food, especially appetizers is average at best but the grilled meat was good.

The value for the price was not there as it is an expensive resturant.

topReviews.author: Lamis El Ghor
topReviews.text: Delicious traditional Lebanese food, the way they used to make it. View is gorgeous, staff is experienced, a pleasure to always go back

name: Caf√© Badaro

topReviews.author: cute panda
topReviews.text: Wow just wow. Really nice place. It wasn't planned at all. It was so pretty and spacious. I asked for the prices first. They had it on a link and a paper, they also have wife. The prices were good so we sat down. Ordered some drinks, chatted and worked. It's so comfy to sit i almost fell asleep the table are big. The atmosphere was nice. No loud noises or bad music. The hot chocolate is so delicious I wasn't expecting that. My friend ordered the smoothie it was pretty good. The waiter was so nice. And the best part every now and then we took a break and went to pet the cats ü•πüíï. Best place ever.

topReviews.author: Dahlia Kh
topReviews.text: Badaro Caf√© is hands down one of my favorite Lebanese restaurants. I‚Äôve been coming here for years, whether with my parents or friends, and it never disappoints. The food is consistently delicious and always on point, while the service is impressively quick. The seating is so comfortable, making it the perfect place to relax and enjoy a meal. I always recommend this spot to everyone‚Äîit truly stands out!

topReviews.author: Amir Habboub
topReviews.text:
Very nice atmosphere

topReviews.author: Afif Banna
topReviews.text:
Oh. My. God. I almost jumped out of my seat that‚Äôs how good it was.
The chicken katsu curry was out of this world, and the ramen? So, so good.

Slightly on the expensive side ; it is not overpriced, just a bit up there. But honestly, worth every penny.
Friendly staff, cozy vibe, great experience overall. Will definitely be coming back.

topReviews.author: The diary guide
topReviews.text:
A very nice place. I loved the Ramen‚Äîthe portions are generous and they are very fair with the ingredients they put inside. The staff were welcoming, well-behaved, and provided good service.

My only negative note is that it was a bit cold inside. Also, as a small suggestion, adding some Japanese-style music would really complete the vibe and transport you to the right atmosphere. It‚Äôs a small place, but definitely a good experience.

The pasta cups are delicious, generously portioned, and always satisfying. Definitely a great place to enjoy a tasty meal!

topReviews.text: This place is a gem. Small lil sandwich and pasta shop right on the street in the middle of a busy pub street. They have impeccable and consistent sandwiches. Their pastas in a cup are also fantastic and it's a treat to watch the guy mix your pasta and sauce in a drink mixer. Super fast, super simple, good food.

topReviews.author: Marc Salloum
topReviews.text: The service is speedy and the staff are amiable. The sandwich tastes great and the paste is good. The salmons sandwich isn‚Äôt the best. Prices are reasonable.

name: Al Halabi Restaurant
description: Al Halabi Restaurant stands out as a culinary treasure in Beirut, celebrated for its exquisite Lebanese dishes that reflect the rich cultural tapestry of the region. This hidden gem invites diners to experience a feast of flavors, from succulent grilled meats to aromatic rice dishes, all served in a warm and inviting atmosphere. It's a true testament to the art of Lebanese cooking, making it a must-visit for food enthusiasts.
bestTimeToVisit: Evenings for a lively dining experience filled with local chatter.
localTip: Be sure to try the mixed grill platter; it‚Äôs a favorite among regulars!
scamWarning: Avoid accepting offers from individuals selling tour packages at inflated prices on the street.

topReviews.author: Makeup By Rouba
topReviews.text:
Well since i was a child, the Halabi restaurant was the best in town, the most delicious and luxurious. Today i decided to visit it for the 1st time, we ordered taboul√®, rkakat ,homos, m7amara ,batata 7arra and machewe mchakal. The star of the show was batata 7arra, so crispy, so delicious, then the rkakat,so crunchy with delicious cheese, but i was so disappointed with the hommos, no taste at all , i ddnt feel neither the citrus neither the garlic.
As a Lebanese traditional restaurant, they should offer at least fruits , the things that they ddnt do it, they ddnt serve anything at all....i visitef Fouwar Antelias, and they were so nice nice and offered fruits. For me, i will not repeat the visit

topReviews.author: Joe Turk
topReviews.text:
Tried Al Halabi today and it was perfect from start to finish. The waiters and team are very professional, the food is great and really tasty. We had fattouch, hummos, chanklish, mouajjanet, ras asfour, ma2ane2, frakeh‚Ä¶ all of them were delicious with good portions. Service is amazing, waiters are polite and professional, and the setting inside is nice with both smoking and non-smoking areas.

It‚Äôs a great spot for a family Sunday lunch, but better to go after 3pm if you want to avoid the lunch rush. Prices are around $30 per person without alcohol and machewe. Definitely recommended if you haven‚Äôt tried it yet.

topReviews.author: Rabih El Hage
topReviews.text: Very good for a Sunday lunch with family. Lebanese food, so delicious and high quality. We ordered the regular dishes but they have a big list of specialties. description: Nestled in the heart of the city, Julienne x Au Vieux Quartier offers a charming atmosphere that pairs perfectly with its exquisite Mediterranean dishes. scamWarning: Always check the menu prices before ordering, as some places may try to upsell items without clear pricing.

topReviews.author: Sareen Akarjalian
topReviews.text:
The ambience and decoration was beautiful. Unfortunately they have a HUGE ventilation issue. Every table in the restaurant had at least 2 cigars and many many many cigarettes. I usually wouldn't mind it except after one hour of being there my eyes were burning and all my clothes stank. I never in my life complain about cigarette smoke but my God they have to find a solution for this. Huge NO if people have issues with smoking.

Food. Sushi pieces were so tiny. It would have been good if the waiter warned us. Calamari appetizer was nice. The rock shrimp with the salad was super tasty. The spinach leaves were marinated in a lovely sauce. The Veal steak was good. Not as tender as I thought it would be and the temperature of the food was cold. It seems they wait to bring all the dishes of all the tables together so by the time our mains arrived (last table) the steak had gotten cold. The pasta with the bolognese sauce was very tasty as well.

Price was expensive compared to the food received

Waiters and service was good and they were polite.

topReviews.author: ELIE AR
topReviews.text: An extraordinary dining experience awaits at this remarkable restaurant! From the mouthwatering crab to the exquisite truffle dishes, every bite was a symphony of flavors. The burger was cooked to perfection, and the orzo seafood dish was a delightful surprise. The julienne truffle was simply divine. The ambiance exudes sophistication with its stunning decor, and the music adds the perfect touch to the atmosphere. A definite must-visit for anyone seeking an unforgettable culinary journey!

topReviews.author: Omar Badr
topReviews.text:
(1) Ambiance:
Credit where credit is due, the ambiance is amazing. That‚Äôs it. Everything else is underwhelming.

(2) Service:
- The hostess was super rude and kept on reminding us that we should leave at 9 over and over again even tho the place was empty.
- We reserved before hand and she wanted to seat us at the bar, but we refused.
- The table we sat on was tight even tho the rest of the place is spacious. They sat us on a table for 4. so we pushed aside the extra two plates to make space for the food. We had to ask the waiters to remove the other plates; they did it eventually but with an attitude.
- As we were collecting our stuff to head out the waiter was trying to remove the empty place and kept bumping into us.

(3) Food:
- The food is super average to say the least. It‚Äôs the most expensive underwhelming meal I had. We ordered a selection of appetizers but the fries took forever; they arrived 15 mins after we finished eating everything else.
- The Strozzapreti Bolognese was really good
- The wasabi was too much. We got the Crab Avocado Salad, and the Red Prawn Carpaccio and they tasted like wasabi. The crab salad was really good once you remove the wasabi bread on top
- Fries taste like Mcdo

As for the prices, they might be on the expensive side for some, but personally, I think they‚Äôre well worth it for the atmosphere and overall experience. If you‚Äôre looking for a place with great energy and delicious food, this is definitely the spot!

topReviews.author: Said Nassar
topReviews.text:
After my initial challenges with making a reservation at Bazalt, I finally had the opportunity to dine there, and I‚Äôm delighted to say that the experience was exceptional and completely changed my perspective.

The host was professional and welcoming, setting the tone for a wonderful evening. The waiter was equally impressive, offering thoughtful suggestions that enhanced our dining experience. The interior of Bazalt, true to its name, has a charming, rocky aesthetic that adds to the ambiance.

The menu was a highlight, featuring a diverse selection of international dishes. We started with the salted edamame, a recommendation from our waiter, which was rich and flavorful. Our culinary journey continued with the exquisite ‚ÄúFraicheur crab,‚Äù made with real crab, and the ‚Äúmarinated salmon,‚Äù which was among the best I‚Äôve ever tasted. The ‚Äúbeef tacos‚Äù and ‚Äúlaburi salmon‚Äù were also delicious, and the ‚Äúmargaret de canard‚Äù with its mango and mushroom touch was exceptional, especially recommended for those who enjoy medium-well cooking. Based on the waiter‚Äôs recommendation, we concluded our meal with the ‚Äúgnocchi truffle‚Äù - a must-try for truffle enthusiasts. Finally, the ‚Äúananas pina colada‚Äù dessert was a delightful end to our meal.

While Bazalt is on the pricier side, the quality of the food and the overall experience justify the cost. I am glad I revisited Bazalt and can now wholeheartedly recommend it to others, especially those who appreciate a diverse, high-quality menu and a welcoming atmosphere.

Previous Experience:
I initially had some challenges with making a reservation and faced a misunderstanding regarding the dress code. However, my latest visit has completely transformed my view of Bazalt, showcasing their commitment to quality and customer service.

This hidden gem offers a selection of local dishes that you can savor while enjoying the serene ambiance of the surrounding landscape. It‚Äôs a perfect getaway for nature lovers and food enthusiasts alike, providing a tranquil setting to unwind and enjoy the beauty of Lebanon's outdoors.

topReviews.author: Elie Beaino
topReviews.text:
Very peaceful place to come to. You can access this place from a bunch of entrances such as parking before the gate at the bottom and hiking up the mountain, it's fairly simple. Or you can park at the top the dam itself and have a long hike all the way around the dam.

It's fairly a straight line and and can hike all the way around easily as there are no difficult parts. It's mostly for chillling and relaxing around the lake.

On the day I was in, there was a group removing tents apparently after a festival,  so this place also hosts festivals. There are also boats, kayak, pedalo activities and the water is very clean as are the whole trail and road.

topReviews.author: Elias Eid
topReviews.text:
Chabrouh Dam: A Gem of Engineering
The Chabrouh Dam is more than just a water barrier; it‚Äôs a masterpiece of engineering. Its wall, a colossal structure composed of solid lebanese rock, is a testament to human skill and resilience. The sheer magnitude and precision of its construction are awe-inspiring. It's truly a gem of modern architecture, seamlessly blending with the natural beauty of its surroundings.
Mybphotos are my personal observations about the dam's wall, and the rocks color is piece of art, or the way it's constructed is amazing.

A visit to the Chabrouh Dam is a must for anyone interested in engineering marvels and natural wonders.

topReviews.author: Freddy Makhoul
topReviews.text:
Enjoy the Beach for Free! üèñÔ∏è

Jbeil's public beach is a fantastic place where you can have a great time by yourself or with friends, and the best part is, it's completely free! It's one of the few activities in Lebanon that won't cost you anything.

The beach is always clean and safe thanks to the hard work of the Jbeil municipality. Lifeguards are also present to ensure everyone's safety.

As you approach the check-point, be prepared for an inspection by the municipality officer to ensure compliance with the "no alcohol" policy. While this may seem restrictive to some, it undoubtedly contributes to maintaining a family-friendly and peaceful atmosphere.

The water is clear and the view is amazing, making it a perfect spot to relax and have fun.

If you're driving, there's a parking area, but it's not free, so keep that in mind.

In conclusion, Jbeil's public beach is a wonderful place to spend a memorable day without spending any money. So, gather your things, enjoy the beautiful view, and have a fantastic time at the beach! üåäüèÑ

I like the idea of adding nest platforms for some birds along water bodies and restoring damaged areas by planting native plants.
Ammiq wetland is well organised, people are smiling welcoming. Maybe you can add some direction signs and elaborate on some trees and plants that we see while hiking. Great job.
